Reviews.Title: “Great luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: gord999
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best hotels I've stayed at in Canada. It is a case of getting what you pay for, and this hotel is not inexpensive. Valet parking great ; Restaurant service and food fantastic ; rooms very well appointed. Location is right downtown Vancouver. Entrance to the hotel although having a West Georgia address; in and out access to the hotel is via Howe Street. From the hotel, there is a very short walk to the waterfront promenade where the sea planes come and go. Lots of shopping in the mall attached to the hotel. A few things that are a little over the top in terms of price that most customers may not notice, but I did. A daily rate of $12.95 for the internet? A price of $7.50 for a 1 litre bottle of water in the room? Free wireless would be nice so one doesn't have to go to the business centre. The answer from the staff that the business centre can be used free of charge, is not a good alternative. Most mornings there is only coffee in the lobby, one morning (Wednesday) there were little muffins as well? What about muffins Monday - Tuesday? I don’t think I am the target customer for this hotel, but I did enjoy my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all areas.”
Reviews.Author: jnags
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Vancouver with our children for two nights at the end of ski vacation. We were looking forward to being pampered at The Four Seasons and we were not disappointed. Everyone went out of their way to know us by name and to make sure that everything was perfect. The pool and hot tub were great. The hotel was centrally located. The restaurant was good and the staff were very attentive. We highly recommend The Four Seasons Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Not value for money”
Reviews.Author: mere50
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to this treat. Unfortunately I can't say I'd recommend staying here. It was advertised as a luxury hotel but didnt live up to this name. Rooms are fine, clean tidy and comfortable, but even the special conference price worked out at $250 Canadian a night. For this price there is no tea or coffee maker in the room, no information book about the hotel so you won't even know where to find such things as the gym and pool. You pay extra for wifi. The toiletries were not topped up each day. Before you ask, did I leave a service tip, yes, but by the last day I was not happy. I recommend staying just a few blocks from the Pacific Centre in one of the hotels that have apartment facilities. There are several, they are modern, clean helpful and include wifi, free local calls, etc etc.

Reviews.Title: “Favourite Vancouver Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarySOttawa
Reviews.Content: Top notch customer service and amenities. Excellent in every area, for business and pleasure. The staff, in particular, are amazing - from porters, to doormen, to the front desk and housekeeping staff - just incredible service! The new menu in the restaurant is great, too. And the downtown location is close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Tyrus C
Reviews.Content: Lovely property, well situated in the heart of Vancouver, great rooms, excellent bar/restaurant, super service!

Reviews.Title: “Superb service, amenities and quality!”
Reviews.Author: PSToronto
Reviews.Content: I stayed for four nights on a combination business and pleasure trip, and found the quality of service, from front desk to concierge to room attendants, to be uniformly excellent. Amenities such as the fitness center with its indoor/outdoor pool and spacious terrace, as well as the always-accessible business center, were great as well. Location could not be better, with direct access to the Pacific Centre and no more than a 5 to 15 minute stroll to just about any location (including the waterfront} in central Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Customer service and attention to detail by Alex Y !”
Reviews.Author: Cindy W
Reviews.Content: Alex checked us in upon arrival. He was hands down, the most wonderful human being you could have ever hired! Good work! He made my son's day by sending a lovely little birthday cake to our room, along with a personal note. My son was so pleased, it really made his 16th birthday. We went to the Canucks game, and upon checkout Alex asked about the game and shook his hand and thanked HIM for sharing his birthday with the Four Seasons. Outstanding customer service and appreciation. My Son is a hockey player, himself and we have stayed in MANY hotels, but have never had an experience like that. I have been extoling the virtues of your hotel to all my colleagues ever since. I will be booking today actually for myself and 3 colleagues for an upcoming seminar in May. It is at the Hotel Vancouver, but I am insisting we all stay at the Four Seasons!

Reviews.Title: “favourite hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Gus002
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here often both for business and visiting family (this most recent trip was for a funeral.). I always feel so well looked after; it's so comfortable. I come back for the service and good value for the luxury . I also enjoy it for the location (center of town connected to the Pacific Centre), its gym and pool and a good in-hotel restaurant. Canada Line provides an inexpensive, fast way to get from the airport to the Four Seasons. It is a clean new light rail transit the leaves from the airport and connects within a hundred steps the hotel through the Pacific Centre- no going outside.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice for downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: 64Sagittarius
Reviews.Content: Fabulous staff and great location. No limit for good service. Children are welcomed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way!”
Reviews.Author: MidwestLiketoTravel
Reviews.Content: First, let us say that we had stayed at the Four Seasons Vancouver back in June 2009 for two nights and had been impressed. But this time around, March 2012, we were able to stay three nights and got to enjoy the facility so much more. To begin, we got an upgraded room and enjoyed a beautiful city view. When we entered the room, a plate of cookies was there to welcome us with a note from the manager. The hotel is in a great location -- atop the Pacific Centre mall, but also in the middle of everything downtown. It is also a stop on the Canada Line train from the airport -- perfect! Facilities were excellent, the gym was a step above, and the whirlpool and swimming pool (indoor/outdoor) met with our satisfaction after two busy days of sight-seeing. Attention to detail has been mentioned before but it goes without saying, when you stay at this Four Seasons, you get the best of Four Seasons treatment. One small item for a midwestern U.S. basketball fan -- we didn't miss much during the NCAA tournament thanks to their vast selection of U.S. television stations (as well as Canada's sports channel, TSN). Finally, it was a short walk to all sorts of restaurants as well as to the Canucks' game. St Patrick's weekend in Vancouver was a blast! Four Seasons Vancouver, we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: taggsbc
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel, every year, for the past 20 years. While many others may reward me with air miles, or reward points, the best reward for me staying here is the friendly staff, the attention to detail with the room service (ice in the buckets, turndown service, putting your hair brush, etc on a towel, replacing towels mid-day) that keep me loyal. They also have the best beds and sheets if you rate having a great sleep as part of your criteria. They get to know you on a name basis, and make the experience, one that has you feeling like it is your 'home away from home'. The professionalism is the best I have experienced in any hotel stay in Canada.The bonus is that the location to many downtown places is just a walk and you don't need to go outside for the largest downtown mall for those who love to shop.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown hotel in an excellent location with a top quality gym”
Reviews.Author: islandgirl3Royston
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in the heart of Vancouver. Has an excellent gym, also an easy to follow outside running route map in the room. The route goes down to the water and around Stanley Park, a really nice run. Lots of nice restaurents, shopping and site seeing all close by.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: ctyankee20
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Nice Rooms. Good views. Great service. Good restaurant. Kid friendly. All at a price that seems great value for money for someone from the US East Coast.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite”
Reviews.Author: Murray P
Reviews.Content: I do a great deal of travelling setting up art shows in various cities. I spend approximately 2 months of every year in a variety of hotels. The Four Seasons in Vancouver is my favourite. It is an older hotel that is extremely well maintained. The rooms are clean, the beds comfortable and the Concierge service is outstanding - they could not be more accommodating and helpful. Promptness, friendliness and careful attention to detail were characteristic of interaction with staff. L'Occitane products in the rooms is a nice touch. The Yew Restaurant on the Second Floor has a wonderful combination of relaxed atmosphere and delicious, well prepared food. The restaurant staff takes time to inform you of selections and to converse with you. The hotel is strategically located in Downtown Vancouver with a shopping centre located in the same complex. Access to the Hotel is excellent with good valet service. One senses a concerted effort to make one's stay as pleasant as possible.

Reviews.Title: “A bit dated but on the right track”
Reviews.Author: liketospend
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here a number of times over the past 10 years. The property has undergone some much needed updating, and the location is fantastic with direct access to the shopping mall. The indoor outdoor pool is another plus, as is the generally well trained and helpful staff. This is an expensive choice of hotel, but for all the reasons stated above it remains a pretty safe bet. (Hint for parents - if you ask nicely they will provide you with mini robes for your kids!)

Reviews.Title: “Always comforting”
Reviews.Author: dubupak
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely older than what I like normally, but everything is in really good condition and the room/bathrooms are clean. I've stayed here several times before and it has been consistently clean and comfortable. The staff of course is top notch - these are people that are very professional and caring/kind without coming across fake. This time, I was close to checking out Rosewood Hotel Georgia, but in the end decided to go with what I know - great service and consistency. I love the L'Occitane products and love that they provide real q-tips, not the fake q-tips w/not much swab at the ends. Seems like every time I stay here though, I always get the same view and maybe same room. The 'city view' I get is of some sort of not pretty roof top, so maybe ask for a decent view even though they say you are getting a 'city view.' The location of the hotel is excellent for any downtown shopping, and any other area in Vancouver is only a short cab trip away. It is small pet friendly and treat our dog very well. Upon arrival they always have a big doggie bed ready for him, along with biscuits and a fiji water! He appreciates it greatly.

Reviews.Title: “Central, comfortable and good service”
Reviews.Author: Chloe S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons hotel for 3 nights before a trip to Sun Peaks skiing. The hotel is excellently located in down town Vancouver, with direct access to a shopping mall and the Canada Line (train) which goes to the airport. We were upgraded to a Deluxe Preffered-View Room, which had stunning views of the sunset when we arrived. The room was very spacious, which a very large and comfortable bed, gorgeous bathroom and bath robes I struggled to get out of! Housekeeping were very efficient and helpful, as were all the staff. The pool and whirlpool were lovely, and the gym equipment looked good (we didn't pack gym clothes!) with coffee and/or flavoured water served available. The business suite provided free internet access and a great printer, which we used to print our boarding passes for our next flight. All in all we had a great experience and were very happy with our stay - if we have the opportunity to visit Vancouver again we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Winter Time!”
Reviews.Author: nayal b
Reviews.Content: In Vancouver we normally go for two days a nice quick place to stay not very nice i will say but still good service people like us but the good thing is a mall is connected to it so that makes it convienent for people like families and friends

Reviews.Title: “The staff were exceptionally courteous”
Reviews.Author: TFSCalgary
Reviews.Content: From the first moment on arrival the staff were exceptionally courteous. The food in the restaurant for breakfast, especially the eggs benedict was really excellent. The rooms are a somewhat dated and old fashioned but very clean and quiet. The suite we had was a combination of 2 rooms and for the price of the upgrade definitely worth it. The location is great, center of town.

Reviews.Title: “Families Stay Away!!!”
Reviews.Author: joshuasmith77
Reviews.Content: I will never stay here again for business. Attended an event and had my wife and two year old son stay with me. Two days after checking out they stated that our two year old son used a pen on one of the pieces of furniture and charged us an additional $1150 to replace the chair. Either put families in rooms where there is some wear and tear expected on furniture, get insurance that covers these sort of events, or make the families aware of the costs from the beginning. I'm a preferred Starwood member but had switched because I liked the location and service during my first few stays at the Four Seasons. This has really soured my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Service over the top”
Reviews.Author: robert b
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Vancouver to attend a dental conference and in addition we were celebrating our 33rd wedding anniversary. Once the hotel found out about our wedding anniversary they went out of their way to make our two day stay exceptional. They made dinner reservations for us and both restaurants not only acknowledged our anniversary but gave us complimentary deserts. Everyone we dealt with at the hotel seem to know about our celebration and the hotel sent up strawberries and chocolate. I would especially like to acknowledge Alex Yao who went out of his way to make our time at the hotel special.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and (VERY) Convenient”
Reviews.Author: EdmondUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for business September 2010 and February 2011. Official website checked and no apparent changes. Here's the review: Couldn't ask for a better location, with my office, shops, restaurants/cafes, public transport and most things worth visiting/seeing in downtown Vancouver within walking distance. The first room I stayed in was a corner room (complimentary upgrade): very classy and spacious with tasteful furniture all around, worthy of 4.5 green dots. Given the standard room I paid for the second time around, which was a lot smaller (half the size, maybe? 2.5 green dots) and took a lot of shine off the first stay. What was consistent, thankfully, were those lovely L'Occitane toiletries. Very helpful and polite staff, as one would expect in a hotel of this calibre in North America. Quite baffling though was the fact that they still charged for internet connection, in this day and age. The gym and pool area was arguably the Achilles' heel of the hotel. The gym was equipped with fairly old machines; having the paddling pool right next to it (without any partitions) also meant that I was exercising with children and their parents in their bathing suits on a few occasions. These were somewhat compensated by nice touches such as complimentary fresh apples and iced water (with various sliced fruits) at the reception for the guests. Great value for money and if you don't belong to any hotel loyalty schemes (Four Seasons doesn't run one but many who do have properties nearby), this hotel is hard to beat. In brief, I would liken this hotel to a graceful old lady who clearly invested a lot of money on her appearance in the past: never shabby, but looks a little worse for wear in parts these days.

Reviews.Title: “Older but classy with a certain timelessness”
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline d
Reviews.Content: Previouly I drifted to newer hotels in Vancouver but recently had a bussiness event at the Four Seasons Hotel and thoroghly enjoyed myself. Their room serivce "Mac&Cheese" was fantastic and just what a girl needed on a cold night in a lonely hotel room. THe hotel really has a certain old time class to it that other newer hotels just don't have.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome gym and pool!”
Reviews.Author: applepie18
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, clean rooms, gym and pool area were kept very clean as well!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury @ it's best!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BorenS
Reviews.Content: By far the best chain of hotels to stay at. I love any Four Seasons whether it is in Canada to San Francisco to Los Angeles. All of these places have my stamp of approval. From the moment you step out of your car to the moment you check out, they have nothing but given their attention to you! Rooms are comfortable and food is very good. Price can creep up but I would not trade this luxury for something else. Stay and you won't regret the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Good Central Choice”
Reviews.Author: slbe
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business mid December. Check in was smooth & efficient. Upon entering my room, there was some strob light effect happening in the bathroom. Front desk was great & issue was resolved by the time i got back from a meeting. Gym & pool are an advantage. Coffee & light breakfast provided in the lobby. Overall would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Effortless comfort in the heart of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Inglenook
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week while on a business trip towards the end of February 2012. I found the Four Seasons offered a very comfortable stay. My room on the 11th floor was a good size, with a very comfortable bed, good place to sit and read plus an excellent desk for working on my laptop. The bathroom was a good size - with bath and shower - and some plush dressing gowns to wear. There is also a large flat-panel TV set in the room. The main restaurant - Yew - is excellent, but pricey. I paid more than $30 for breakfast - the food was delicious, but there are several better-value restaurants within easy walking distance. The location of the hotel is right in downtown Vancouver, sitting on top of one of the malls, with a Metro station on the line which serves YVR airport. Most places in the downtown are a short walk - and if it is raining outside, the hotel has a good set of umbrellas for you to use. My only complaint relates to the standard internet service, which is on the slow side - but there is an option to upgrade to a faster service for an extra daily fee. I'd certainly stay at the Four Seasons again when I'm next in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Bus trip”
Reviews.Author: starpilot1
Reviews.Content: Always a great place- lived here almost a month 2009- now seeing some slight decline. Service is good- the hotel is scrambling as they must for the business crowd for the restaurant. Yew remains the signature Four Seasons Vancouver restaurant. It recently reinvented itself as a premier seafood restaurant. I visited with a non seafood loving 20 year old in tow. As a hotel guest- I was a bit miffed at being- and feeling- put off for seating. I am a bit huffy- I admit- and like to think just because I am spending all that pricey money to stay at the Four /seasons- i should get some kind of consideration for seating in the restaurant. Well I did not have that sense of security and relied on Lady Luck it seems who was smiling on James (20 yr old) and self both nights recently. That said- apart from anxiety and this being the ONLY hotel venue apart from room service- we did get seats both nights to dine. Nuff said on that! How was the food? Very decent. Almost and at times spectacular. The lobster poutine- well that does tend to be a bar/low rent - high priced item- could be trendy but: done amazingly well with lots of lobster and great gravy- prefer higher end potatoes fresh cut and firm deep fried but0 hey- pick your battles. We preferred lots of lobster in the sauce which is just what we got. The fish stew- aka bouilabaise- lacke stock and freshness with reliance on a much too canned tomato stock. Had that the first night and not eager for a second. That dish should be redolent of the sea, full of seafood and NOT tomatoes- they are there for a complement, not the main course. Every thing else should- be memorable- but was not. Decent OK what one expects to pay for but tends to be 'hotel food' and despite re-inventing themselves- not much more. then again did not spend extensive time on the menu- will do so on an upcoming trip!

Reviews.Title: “Service above and beyond!”
Reviews.Author: leah664
Reviews.Content: We booked a fabulous rate at this hotel as three of us were taking in a show in Vancouver and didn't want to drive home afterwards. A little mini-holiday, if you will. It started at check in. We just did the self park less than a block away (6 bucks a day on the weekend) and went to the front desk. That's where we started to get blown away. The wonderful girl that checked us in (can't remember her name) was so detailed and friendly. She even walked us all the way to the elevator and waited until it arrived. Wow. Up to the 16th floor and our room was very nice. Big windows, comfy bed, and later a knock on the door to do up the sofa bed for the third person. This hotel is in a wonderful location, and will definitely be our first choice next time we feel the need to be a tourist in our own town!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: cork95
Reviews.Content: When I travel with my family, we usually choose budget accommodation, that is why I can't compare the Four Seasons (where I went for a conference) with other similar-rated hotels in Vancouver. I was however impressed not only by my room (I was on the 20th floor and had a very pretty view) and location (an entrance right from the mall!) but especially by the staff. A special mention goes to the servers in the restaurant, who gave me information about possible allergens in my breakfast food choice, when they learned of my food intolerances, and who offered me gluten free bread even before I thought of asking for it. And to the cleaning person, who put a real mousepad under my laptop mouse instead of the piece of paper I was using. And to the reception staff, who were very obliging when I arrived and when I needed help in the business room. Easy and quick check-out as well. It really was an excellent stay. Maybe next time I'll get to go in the summer, and see a bit of sunshine?

Reviews.Title: “Impressive service, quality sleep and knockout location!”
Reviews.Author: LVaccaro
Reviews.Content: I really appreciated my stay at the Four Seasons Hotel. Having stayed at the Fairmont Pacific Rim on many occasions since its opening, I have to hand it to the F.S.Hotel staff! They really stepped up the quality service to make one totally satisfied about their stay, despite the hotel not being as recent! The proximity to the Pacific Center, the excellent Yew Restaurant-pub, makes for a great stay in Vancouver. They even provided me with a room upgrade without my requesting! I will stay at this hotel from here on!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GIMD
Reviews.Content: I stay here several times a year on both business and pleasrue and usually bring my family. We returned earlier this month and were not disappointed. The staff recognizes us and they even provided birthday presents for my kids (twins) even though their birtthday was a month before. (They had asked when all our birthdays were on a previous visit so it must be in our profile). Service and food top-notch as usual.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern and beautiful. It is conveniently connected to a shopping mall and the rail transit station. The room was spacious and clean and the housekeeping service was excellent. Area recommendations Go to Stanley Park and rent a bicycle or rollerblades. Burnaby was interesting and a walk around Deer Lake takes about 45 minutes and is quite interesting. there are a lot of beautiful houses and landscaped yards to admire.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like Royaly!”
Reviews.Author: Stan H
Reviews.Content: An amazing stay, treated like royalty. An example, I requested access to a microwave to reheat some food - room service came to pick up my food which was in 2 plastic containers, heated it, brought it back in 2 China dishes along with a serving table / tablecloth, place setting for 2, 2 glasses of ice-water, delivered to my room! did I say AMAZING?!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, every time”
Reviews.Author: ednacloud
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here just before Christmas and spent the evening with friends in the hotel's Yew restaurant + bar. Our room was great, very comfortable and well-appointed. The bed was incredibly comfortable. The hotel has undergone renovations in the last few years and still remains a great destination in downtown Vancouver. There are newer hotels in the vicinity but this remains our favourite. Yew is always a great pleasure, with excellent food, drink and service. We have never had a negative experience at this hotel and it will continue to be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, other areas need some work”
Reviews.Author: travelinteacher1282
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in December to celebrate my 30th birthday. I will try to breakdown our stays into what I would consider to be some pros and cons. Pros: - location was PERFECT. Across the street from the Canada Line, above the mall, and walking distance to Robson Street, Gastown, Canada Place, Stanley Park (a bit longer of a walk). The only day we didn't walk was we took a cab to Granville Island, then a ferry from there to Yaletown, then the Canada Line back to the hotel. Everywhere else we walked. Taxis are abundant in front of the hotel if you need one though. -Rooms were very clean and hotel overall was very peaceful and quiet -Pool/jacuzzi/gym area was on the fourth floor and well maintained. Pretty view of the city and nice to unwind at the end of the day. -Lobby area was nicely decorated with Christmas trees for the holiday season Cons: -view was of a building rooftop even being on the 10th floor -shower/tub combo was VERY small and narrow -initial check in treatment was poor. We were the only ones checking in at the time and no one helped us with our luggage. When asked for help by bellmen outside, they told us to go to registration, where no one helped us there either. We told the lady at the desk upon check in it was our first time at a Four Seasons as usually we stay at the Marriott's when staying at a nicer hotel and we were celebrating my 30th birthday. The only thing she offered was for us to pay 150 more a night for a slightly larger room. We passed. -Staff service overall was mixed. One lady at the concierge desk was very helpful while another acted like we were bothering her. Some bellmen outside were helpful with directions and such while others like with our luggage practically ignored us. Overall, it was a great location and very small, but nice and clean rooms. We stay at all levels of accommodations ranging from budget to JW Marriotts. We just felt like for a five star hotel and what we paid, service was spotty and it was closer to a 3 or 4 star treatment versus what we have experienced at other 5 star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Martina R
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons Vancouver, was excellent, all the staff were very welcoming and extremely helpful. The food in Restaurant was great. I fell in love with Vancouver and the hotel made it even more attractive.

Reviews.Title: “Bounce back-it's wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Rosalyn M
Reviews.Content: This was the fifth consecutive year we have stayed at the Four Seasons Vancouver, from late December to early January 2012. As usual it was a wonderful experience. We love the hotel's central location and we enjoy walking to many venues around Vancouver from the hotel, like Stanley Park, shopping in Robson Street, Gastown, Yaletown, False Creek harbour walk and English Bay. There are many excellent restaurants within walking distance and the outstanding concierges will make your reservations. In fact they got a reservation for me which I had been unable to obtain myself. We always arrive with huge amounts of luggage (we stay in Vancouver before we go skiing in Silver Star) and the staff take care of it all, we just walk in to reception and begin our holiday in Canada. Love it!!!! Ps The beds are great and bathrooms have lovely toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “An Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: UsuallyEasyTPlease
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Seasons Vancouver early Januray 2012 for several days, and would strongly recommend this hotel. the rooms are very large, very clean, bed was excellently comfortable, nicely appointed. the bathroom included lovely bathrobes with satin lining - wow. And, included is a $30 credit for breakfast in-room or in the restaurant - this bought a fabulous salmon eggs benedict, cut fresh fruit, juice, coffee, toast on the side with marmelade, etc. Yum, and it was free. I would definitely stay there again. Plus, the concierge was quite helpful in suggesting a local Japanese restaurant within our group's budget ($30/person including two drinks and so much sushi and other food we were all stuffed). They also provided a free behind the counter safe for my quite expensive computer that did not fit into the room safe. Worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and we would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Laura K
Reviews.Content: This was a fabulous experience. Staff are fabulous. We attended a dinner party in the Park Ballroom and the meal and service were superb. The guestrooms are pretty and have everything you need. The beds are very comfortable and sheets are a really nice feeling cotton. The towels are typical hotel towels but they don't reek to bleach which is really nice. We would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: MarkSumner
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons hotels always deliver excellent service. This hotel is no different and you can expect the highest level of service from this staff. Very friendly and helpful. Four Seasons Vancouver is in a great location, within walking distance to shopping on Robson. Close proximity to many restaurants and walking distance to cool shops in Gastown. The only issue I would point out is that it is an older hotel. It is well kept and rooms are well appointed, but it may be due for some updating in the near future. Don't let that put you off though, it is a great place to stay, if not the best place to stay in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: Italiafan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for six nights for a conference. Location is great. Room was spacious, bed was heaven. Staff are helpful. On down side Internet at just over 11 bucks a day is ridiculous. Hotels should give this for free. There is no hotel directory in room so it is a pain to keep asking for everything. Concierge however is very helpful as are doormen. Room service was quick but I had the worse Club sandwich I have ever had anywhere. Hotel responded to my complaint by not charging. Could have done with tea/coffee facility in room. Found out later free coffee available in reception after 6am which was a good facility. Breakfast was good although set menu tiring after a few days. Prefer buffets. Did not like dinner menu much and bar while ok is very noisy. room was serviced well but one day was not cleaned until after 2.30 pm. Really don't like expectation of tips continually in hotels, USA and Canada - just wish that this would change as a result of better wages.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Anna P
Reviews.Content: Fantastic stay in Four Seasons, Vancouver after 10 days of skiing in Whistler. Very welcoming staff, great rooms, our suite had a bedroom and separate sitting room and our 2 kids shared a big sofa there. Very nice fish restaurant, though the choice of fish is a bit limited. The only weak point is that there isn't buffet breakfast, only service. Though our breakfast was quite nice. Everything is so close - art gallery, shopping, old district... Can strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, friendly staff :-)”
Reviews.Author: MrKandMrsM
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped out of the taxi it was nothing but great service. The doormen were attentive the check-in staff was accommodating. We had requested an early check in and asked for a few extra things be added to our room and it was pretty much ready even before we were supposed to check in. Anything we required they would get it done asap. The room was clean, we had a beautiful view of the city and the mountains and water, it was great. The gym/pool/spa facilities was great. The area is very clean, although there was not a ton of equipment it was never too busy, so you could always get on to one of the exercise machines. I do not have one bad thing to say about this hotel! It is connected to shopping and the train, close to all amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: travelrevi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the center of downtown with close proximity to great restaurants and all public transportation. It is connected to the mall and has a great restaurant and bar. The mixed cocktails are outstanding. The beds are extremely comfortable and the hotel is very clean. However, the room service is inconsistent and you have to stay on top of them to have the room cleaned during the day. They are more consistent with turn down service which is strange. The concierge service is top notch and never gave a bad recommendation in the 5 days we were there. I recommend the hotel and would stay again. The only down side is you can hear too much noise in surrounding rooms due to thin walls but that is the norm with most hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, loved, loved”
Reviews.Author: Elena A
Reviews.Content: Stayed during the Vancouver Marathon, it was a great experience, the staff was so helpful when any question was asked. Food was great as well. Will stay again next year during marathon weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: PabloCV
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons during Christmas. I rented a Christmas tree and it was all set in my room when we arrived. This was a great experience for my family. The location is great, connected to the shopping center. We all had a great stay at the hotel. The restaurant ambience and quality of food was superb. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely property,with great service and central to everything”
Reviews.Author: Earthman83
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed an executive suite here on the 9th floor over the new years weekend. It had a spacious bedroom and separate living room both with city views and of the swimming pool below. There were 2 full bathrooms with showers,a very handy feature indeed. Check in was friendly and effecient and a special mention to the door staff,they love their job,and are so genuinely friendly and helpfull.Theres no put on there,the smiles and the warmth are real, you can tell.We ate lunch at the yew restaurant and also breakfast,all lovely. The bar area of Yew is a super area to hang out for drinks,again with great friendly staff and bar tenders. The hotel is walkable to most things in the city centre and in my opinion very good value for what you get. We will be back :)

Reviews.Title: “Good but could be better”
Reviews.Author: PMok
Reviews.Content: I had a pleasant stay for 3 nights just before Christmas. Unbeatable downtown location. Everything was smooth and the service from all staff was very good. The hotel is a bit old and could use an upgrade. It does not feel truly luxurious which is what I would expect from a Four Seasons. One thing to add is that the mattress was not very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: F88
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at several Vancouver hotels over the years (Delta, Wall Center, Westin Grand, Hyatt, Fairmont), but nothing compares to the Four Seasons on our most recent visit. We stayed in a Deluxe Preferred View Suite (stay 2 nights get 3rd free) on the 26th floor and had a great stay from start to finish. This room was totally worth the price, large and at the end of the hall. Our room was spacious and had a nice view of the water and mountains, away from the busy street noise. I requested a roll a way bed and bathrobes for our kids, which were there upon our arrival. Cookies and juice were brought to our room a few minutes later. The indoor/outdoor pool was great fun for our kids, swimming under the stars of of a cold winter night was special. The exercise equipment was in the same room as the pool, so my husband and I were able to work out while keeping an eye on our kids in the pool. There is a kids playroom on the same floor as the check in desk, equipped with video games, board games, books, crafts, etc. Our valet parked car was always quickly brought up for us and our in-room dining arrived quickly as well. It was apparent that this Four Seasons excels in customer service with every employee, from the door man to housekeeping to the restaraunt hostess to the bell hop to the valet attendent. This isn't the lowest priced hotel in the city, but if you're looking for a higher end hotel in Vancouver that will take care of you from beginning to end this is the place to stay. We can't wait to go back again this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Will always stay at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Andrea D
Reviews.Content: Not only is the Canada Line most convenient from the airport, it allows you to get straight downtown to your hotel which is also linked to the Pacific Center Mall. Very convenient. I loved the guest room, the sheets were amazing and the beds very comfortable. The staff at this hotel make all the difference with their kindness and helpfulness. I love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The personal touch, service, quality and reliability have been consistent for over 10 yrs of visits.”
Reviews.Author: Stewart M
Reviews.Content: The service in the bar was as always exceptional. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, centrall y located next to LRT with great service.”
Reviews.Author: Harry F
Reviews.Content: I try stay at the Four Seasons when in Vancouver if the price is right. They had a special where third night was free. I always find service excellent and this time was no exception. However the matress was a little soft, maybe time for replacement. They have a great fitness centre with great equipment and I like a hotel with evening turndown service. I was in Vancouver on business and the hotel is conveniently located next to City Centre LRT stop and my client was a few blocks away from the hotel within walking distance. There is a pharmacy and supermarket close by and plenty of restaurants. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and friendly luxury”
Reviews.Author: Canadiana2008
Reviews.Content: I liked: - quick check in - beautiful hallways - nicely decorated room - very comfortable bed - in room amenities - very courteous staff - good value for that class - a choice of newspaper can be done with a door note, WSJ available and no extra charge Didn't like: - reception on a floor above the street level (escalator) - ridiculously pricey breakfast... Oatmeal, a beautiful fruit plate plus latte with taxes and tip cost $35. It was delicious and the service was spotless, but still seems ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: catherine8878
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel. The room was spacious, lovely and clean, bed very comfortable. Restaurant Yew really delicious. Staff very courteous and great service all around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vancouver hotel, and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: R F
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to Vancouver several times over recent years and have always enjoyed staying at this hotel. The hotel's facilities and location are excellent, and each of my several stays have been completely problem-free. Off-season rates are also quite reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and great pool & gym”
Reviews.Author: Emily S
Reviews.Content: A luxury hotel with a really friendly and accomodating staff. The pool, gym, sauna area is heavenly. Very convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and very comfortable beds.”
Reviews.Author: JP987654321
Reviews.Content: The staff were courteous, genuine and the service was excellent. The room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. The food was extremely good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful and Decident”
Reviews.Author: Wendy B
Reviews.Content: My experience at the Four Season's Hotel in November 2011 was wonderful. The staff from all departments were gracious, humble, helpful and always had a smile on their face no matter the request I had. The beds were heavenly with the feather bed topping the matress, soft pillows, and king size just for me. The food was delicious (but pricey). I enjoyed my experience as a treat but that is all I could afford. All in all, the hotel was wonderful and I recommend it for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “50th Birthday Celebration!”
Reviews.Author: FitForCruising
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at the Four Seasons, Vancouver and a very memorable evening. The staff immediately recognized that it was my birthday and went out of their way to make it a memorable one. Amy at the front desk had a card signed and sent to my room along with a special Happy Birthday fruit plate. She had extra plates, wine glasses and cutlery sent to our room within 10 minutes! Amazing service!! Thank you! I am a travel agent and I will definitely recommend the Four Seasons, Vancouver to all my clients! I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Superior luxury, quiet and serene yet in the absolute middle of downtown.”
Reviews.Author: Darryl G
Reviews.Content: I was impressed by the quietness of the room, at the very heart of downtown Vancouver. Within walking distance of the courthouse, attached to Pacific Centre Mall, a few steps to the Metro...and a superior bed to sleep on with luxurious pillows.

Reviews.Title: “The Location is central to everything”
Reviews.Author: octavio m
Reviews.Content: The Location is central to verything you could need and want in Vancouver. Excellent check in/ out. Rooms are very clean and confortable. Excellent king bed. You have free access to internet / 3rd floor with your room key/two computers. Thank you for given me a wanderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: _PheobeK_
Reviews.Content: The location is central to everything you could need/want in Vancouver. The check-in was efficient and friendly. The room was very clean and comfortable with a cozy king sized bed. Wireless was $11/day. The YEW restaurant had a great breakfast menu, be sure to try the chicken sausage - yum! Although the food was a little pricey, it was very good and for a busy business day kept me going until I returned to the hotel in the evening. Out of all the hotels I have stayed at, this was #1 in my books.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a joke! Stay away.”
Reviews.Author: koala25
Reviews.Content: My husband gets a special rate at Four Seasons in the Middle East and Southeast Asia and I've had positive experiences staying with them...until I decided to spend a long weekend at this property. I thought you could not go wrong with Four Seasons, but this was a rude awakening after staying at Four Seasons in Bangkok, Chang Mai, Sharm-el-Sheikh, Houston, and Amman. Upon arrival I called the reception upon arrival, because I couldn't locate the hotel directory in the room. They said they don't have one. Now I know why! Because there's nothing, I mean nothing at this hotel! Staff: They couldn't care less you're staying there. The people at the front desk are unfriendly and won't go out of their way to help you. Whenever you talk to them, they don't smile and tend to give you Yes/No answers. Room: The furniture is old and the room has a Holiday Inn feel rather than Four Seasons.There's no tea/coffee maker in the room.The tiny cheap hairdryer is pathetic! Is it a toy for Barby? It took me 30 minutes to blow dry my hair and in the end it looked like crap. Spa: There's no SPA! It didn't occur to me to ask at the time of booking if they have a SPA, because all of the other Four Seasons I've ever stayed at have one and I assumed it was standard. Fitness Center: This is not a state-of-the-art fitness facility as some other reviewers describe, but a tiny, damp, and dingy room with very few old and rusty machines. It's right next to the swimming pool and working out was a torture because of the screaming kids in the pool.There was a guy there when I checked in, but he disappeared and never came back, so I had to go to the reception to ask a question that I wanted to ask him. Walking into the locker room I felt like I was in a YMCA in not such a nice part of town.They don't even have a steam room. It's pathetic! Food: On the room service menu they have "Big Salads", so I decided to order one. When I order a "big salad" I expect to receive a salad that is large enough to be a substitute for a main course.Guess what? I paid about $40 for five uncut romaine leaves, four very thin pieces of tuna, and one half of grilled lemon. What a rip off! I also ordered a cup of coffee and was brought a thermos of coffee.I hate waste of any kind and was infuriated that they charged me for 3 cups of coffee, because that's what they put in the damn thermos. Guess what, most people don't drink a whole thermos of coffee at once, so I basically ended up paying for something I did not need. Breakfast: It was very average. There's no buffet, only a la cart menu. Paid about $45 for an omelet and coffee. I ordered pancakes the next day and the syrup that came with them was very thin and watery (I suspect they dilute it). It wasn't pure maple syrup and we are in Canada, out of all places! Restaurant: I came in around 3:00 p.m. and was presented with a very limited snack menu. The hostess did not walk me to the table, just pointed to it. Then came the waiter! I don't even know how they hired this country bumpkin to serve guests. He was very sloppy and borderline rude. When he brought the check there was no pen inside and he didn't hear me yelling to him to bring a pen as he was walking away. One of the guests gave me a pen. Needless to say, I did not leave a tip. When I was checking out, they asked me how my say was and I told them it was disappointing. They asked me if I wanted to talk to the manager, but I was in a hurry, so I said "No". I asked one of the receptionists to take my suitcase downstairs, which she did, but she just put in on the ground and left without saying goodbye. This was plain rude and I'm shocked and disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, excellent rooms, excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: Ve_Lu_Me
Reviews.Content: Please don't get any second ideas by reading negative comments about this hotel. In all my buisiness travels, this hotel was truely one of the best I've stayed in and experienced. The staff is very friendly as well as very helpful. They offer excellent service in every department in every way. The rooms are very comfortable and you don't hear your neighbours. The hotel/rooms/restaurant/finess center/etc. are very clean and have a modern decor. I would recommend this hotel to my friends and work colleagues. I would definitely come back for buisiness as well as for leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: Qusan
Reviews.Content: Oh? Did anyone else stay at the Four Seasons in Vancouver October 28-November1? The way my daughters and I were treated and pampered, we thought WE were the only guests. That's the secret to a truly memorable and delightful experience which the Four Seasons seems to understand. From the doorman who greeted us and grabbed our luggage, to the front desk who, seconds later, greeted us by name as we emerged from the ground floor to the lobby on the escalator, we felt royal. Jarrett, the front desk manager, escorted my daughters and me to three different rooms with three different views so we could choose our preference. Although I was pleased with all views (did NOT see any like those city rooftops others posted), we decided to upgrade to a junior suite on the 24th floor. We enjoyed mountain and waterfront views and the frequent flights of seaplanes. In fairness, the view was not unobstructed. You are in the middle of downtown so there are other tall buildings around. Centrally located, we walked to many venues, including the waterfront, galleries, restaurants and Rogers Arena where we watched the Canucks vs the Caps. The concierges were knowledgeable, helpful and efficient. Our information was accurate and suggestions excellent. I slept on a rollaway bed and..... slept well. On a rollaway! Wow. I could have stayed on the hideaway bed but there was plenty of space in the room and it was my choice for the rollaway. The girls had the king bed and were very comfortable. Some things that could have improved our stay.....free WiFi. Shocking it is not provided although we used the business center for our internet and printing needs. Also, would have liked a hotel guide with amenities listed. Kris, our exceptional bellman, answered any and all questions we had on arrival. Even so, more information at our fingertips would have been desirable. The Yew restaurant was expensive and I grumbled at the price of my breakfast as I ordered. But, hey, I had the best morning meal I've had in ages and the price was comparable to the value and service received. All in all, I would stay again and recommend it to others for perfect location, great staff, service and comfort and cleanliness of our suite.

Reviews.Title: “Beds comfy as a cloud”
Reviews.Author: Shawna M
Reviews.Content: We stayed Oct. 29 through to Nov. 4, 2011. The hotel is centrally located, a block from dining and shopping and four blocks from the waterfront and the convention centre where we spent our days. The room was a good size, with the bed a comfy as a cloud. Our rooms were cleaned and freshened up daily. The only issue is that you have to pay $12/day for Internet use. The indoor/outdoor pool was a nice touch and the fruit infused water in the pool/gym was a nice touch. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: flying-olive
Reviews.Content: We arrived in town September 17th for a convention. Check-in was a breeze. Throughout our stay, we were treated like royalty. The housekeeping was inpeccable; our room always had fresh towels and toiletries. I also want to give a "shout out" to Hugh, the Concierge. There were eight women in our group booking last minute excursions and he was so helpful; loved him! We also had dinner at Yew one night, which was superb. If we ever come to Vancouver again, I would definitely stay at the Four Seasons and would highly recommend it to everyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Four Seasons Experience!”
Reviews.Author: 2catsinphilly
Reviews.Content: We recently vacationed in Vancouver and when researching hotels, chose the Four Seasons which offered a promotion where every 3rd night was free. We stayed six nights and had an outstanding experience. Our suite was on the 27th floor with a lovely view, two full baths, spacious bedroom and living room. The hotel is centrally located and features an indoor/outdoor pool. The restaurant was great for breakfast or lunch and had a vibrant bar scene in the evenings. The staff seemed genuinely happy we were staying there and went out of their way to help us with any detail, from directions to transportation to restaurant recommendations to discount attraction tickets. The fitness center and spa was well-equipped and the personal trainers were outstanding. Included in our stay were complimentary fitness classes which we used daily. The indoor/outdoor pool was great and the landscaped deck area was an inviting place to relax after a day of touring. While there are many fine hotels to choose from in Vancouver, we would return to the Four Seasons again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but overpriced for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Feneant
Reviews.Content: We booked a 'Panoramic City View' room at this hotel through Expedia. It was reasonably priced there as we also booked a flight but the room appears to cost approximately 375$ a night off the Four Seasons website (In October no less)- and what does this get you? A tiny hotel room in the downtown area with a view. I mean there's no doubt it's a luxury hotel, everything is sparkling and well kept- it looks great and you can easily see why it's a 5 star property. The location is excellent, you are within walking distance of most of the major attractions. It's also near a Skytrain station and getting a cab proved easy enough as well. But the downside to this hotel is that everything is expensive (8$ bottle of water in your room!!), nothing is included and everyone you meet expects to be tipped. I think my disappointment is my own fault though, I assumed that 5 star at a luxury hotel meant a nice large room but this was one of the smallest hotel rooms I've ever slept in. The bathroom was also very average, I've had much better at cheaper hotels. It did have an LED TV though, no often you will see that in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hotel”
Reviews.Author: kalidr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for just 3 nights. I was impressed by the friendly staff who helped us unload our luggage and the quietly efficient Reception staff who checked us in. The room was spacious, clean and provided good ambience. The king size bed was comfortable. When service was requested, the Housekeeping staff was friendly and helpful. It provided all the experience of a top notch hotel. Although I did not have the chance to use the "Yew" Restaurant, I was told that it's very good. The gym and swimming pool were great also. Everyone I encountered at the hotel was efficient, helpful and courteous. Of course, one would say that's only to be expected at all Four Seasons hotels worldwide. I do agree but it does not decry my good experience provided by the staff at the Vancouver hotel. Additionally, the locale is excellent, ease of access with Skytrain, and excellent shopping opportunities galore, without getting wet when it rained. It rained whilst I was there.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eva M
Reviews.Content: Very convenient by location for everything in vancouver. Step into pacific mall for quick shopping. Clean rooms. House keeping staff was excellent. Very helpfull. Room service was quick and excellent too. Special thanks to the ladies at housekeeping for taking care of the demanding kids.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay the next time in town.”
Reviews.Author: aloha-girl-1822
Reviews.Content: Special popcorn and soda treat for my kids upon arrival. comfortable bed and luxurious bedding. room was spacious, clean and upscale.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Stay at a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: mexjill
Reviews.Content: If you are a Four Seasons regular you know what kind of service to expect, if not, stay here at least once if you can. The rooms have been redecorated in the last couple of years; they are gorgeous! They're still tinkering with the restaurant "Yew" but so far the newest version is garnering rave reviews. We love the attentive staff and the indoor/outdoor pool all right in the heart of downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “The Four Seasons cannot be compared to any other luxury hotels... It is the very essence of class and hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: ElleG178
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Hotel is the very essence of class, luxury and hospitality. I stayed at two other hotels in Vancouver. The Fairmont - where they think snobbery is a reflection of their status and give you second rate service if you show up at the door with mud on your tires and the Westin.....well.....you have to beg for service there. Always stay at the Four Seasons....you wont be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “First time visitor to a Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: Barbara P
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons Vancouver was an excellent choice of Hotel due to it's being so central to everything that is going on in the city. My only dissappointment was no coffee or tea making facility in the room. Being on a vacation of a lifetime, travelling from East to West Canada this was the only hotel that didn't provide this room facitily, which was a shame as it is exceptional in every other aspect. Complimentary tea and coffe was available in reception but it would have been nice to be able to have had lesiurely in the comfort of your room.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: ashotelsgo
Reviews.Content: false service, below average for the rate compared with similar, stayed in an exec suite, 'so called', tiny bathroom, limited space to hang clothes, a safe so small even the macbook didn't fit, no coffee in the room, no complimentary water even, a basic for most 4/5 star. Tired, miss matched furniture and limited facilities. By comparison it's not as bad as the Fairmont, it's a lot worse than a suite in the Sutton Place where the service really is outstanding. Even the service at the Sheraton is better, although it also needs a refurbishment. For this standard of hotel it's way below expectations and I guess I just thought the Four Seasons was different, well it is, but not in a good way! (also very noisy, bad sound proofing, outside and in, don't stay here at least while they are fitting new carpets and only if you like a really soft bed that's bad for the back).

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is extraordinary for perfection of service and just everything = the only place to stay in Vancouver, B.C.”
Reviews.Author: J R L
Reviews.Content: Absolutely marvelous! We have stayed at the Four Seasons for over 20 years now whenever we are in Vancouver. Never have suffered a disappointment with anything as the rooms are impecible and the service is totally outstanding! If you have not stayed here you should because treating yourself to a trip to Vancouver can only be surpassed by a stay at the Four Seasons. Truly a leader in service and professionalism. If you need anything, the information is just a call away.

Reviews.Title: “A class above the rest......................”
Reviews.Author: circe64
Reviews.Content: Among the numerous choices for hotels in the city of Vancouver, the Four Seasons stands out as a leader. If you've never stayed at a Four Seasons property, you owe it to yourself to book a room at this outstanding hotel in the heart of Vancouver. Classically subtle in luxurious amenities, the rooms and suites contain all you would expect from a hotel of this quality. Linens and towels are pure cotton, duvets and pillows are feather and down, beds are incredibly comfortable. The suites have two bathrooms, four telephones, and two TV's. The staff are friendly and knowledgeable. Although the hotel is in the center of the city, close to restaurants, shopping, and public transport, there is a water view from the rooms on the upper floors. Room service was elegant without being pretentious. The room service menu prices were quite reasonable. It's very easy to navigate the city from this location. This is definitely a hotel that merits repeated visits.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: marboe1223
Reviews.Content: I can't imagine that someone could write a bad review about this hotel. Those who do, must be rediculously spoiled in this life, as this hotel is clean, centrally located and the service provided by their staff was outstanding. Our room on the 20th floor was beautiful. We stayed in Vancouver for a week. Almost every night we went to the Yew and had a night cap. Bengie, our bartender was wonderful! The rest of the staff beckoned to our every need. Vancouver is a beautiful city and we found everyone to be helpful and friendly. We would certainly stay at the Four Seasons again!

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable overnight stay.”
Reviews.Author: cornishdragon2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel prior to embarking on a cruise the following day.Our room 614 was very nice a large comfortable bed etc.good shower and nice supply of shower gel/shampoo.At last a room which provides two comfy chairs for guests to relax in rather than the more usual one. The hotel was in a good position not too far from the main shopping area and within reach of quite a few restaurants.The hotel lounges are very tastefully furnished with pleasant areas for seating. The staff were very friendly and helpful. If we had to stay again we would probably ask for a different room as there was an air conditioning unit just below our window which was quite noisy.If you go out for breakfast the White Spot was very good and quite well priced.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel- but not a Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: 98chevysub
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at The Four Seasons Hotel in Vancouver the weekend of September 25. I booked an upgraded corner room on the 18th floor with a view. Upon entering the room, there was a musty smell. That was the most overwhelming aspect of the room. The window did open two inches for fresh air so I kept it open. There was a lingering odor of cigarette smoke too. The room was clean, but that is where the praise ends. The Four Seasons brand carries with it a certain level of luxury, design and aesthetic. This location is not representative of the brand in any way. The bathroom was so small it was hard to turn around in it, and the tub/shower combo didn't drain properly so I had to stand in 6 inches of water while showering. And there was no ventilation in the tiny bathroom so it got foggy and had to clear out. The bath rug was vinyl! The decor is clean lines, but dated. There is nothing beautiful or interesting to look at- no art work or fabric which is pleasing to the eye. There is no sensory pleasure at all in the room, or hotel itsel as far as I could see. I needed assistance from the concierge twice, and both times they gave me incorrect information. The restaurant, Yew, on the other hand is superb! They aren't kidding about making a reservation though. It is the only food source besides room service for the whole hotel. Also patrons not staying at the hotel dine at Yew. So it will be fully booked. Make a reservation to avoid the frustration of having to go outside the hotel to eat. The food at Yew and the service is exceptional. We were very pleased! I would consider this a business hotel. It is not to be confused with the pampering and luxury usually associated with Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Steph C
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night, but everyhting about the hotel and staff could not be faulted. Our room was upgraded, it was extremely comfortable. The restaurant and bar are amazing with good food, wines and cocktails and our waiter David was the best

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: floridagolfgirl
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that I would love to spend the entire month of August 2012 living in Vancouver in the Four Seasons. Love the location of this hotel whether for business or pleasure. Stanley Park, Granville Island, fantastic restaurants, Museum of Art, shopping and more shopping all there for your enjoyment. And, only a two hour (absolutely breathtaking) drive on the Sea to Sky Highway to Whistler. Incredible August weather, snow still on the mountains, less foot traffic and hospitality at its best. Love the Urban feel and atmosphere at the Yew Restaurant (in the Four Seasons). We were treated to an evening of tapas by Yew's new chef and it was truly mouthwatering and entertaining. Don't miss breakfast - order one of the gourmet omlets from the menu! As for room accomodations - bedding, cleanliness, amenities, turn down service - all up to the exceptional standards of the Four Season's. We stayed in both suite and delux room accomdations as we spent time in Vancouver upon our arrival in BC and upon our departure from BC. In an ideal world, the delux room (and bathroom) could be a tad bit larger. Hard to find a solution to that dilemma unless they start from scratch and level the hotel - which I'm sure is not an option. What the room lacks in size is more than made up for in service and amenities. Our suite accomodations were perfect. If you are looking for dinner reservations outside the hotel - the concierge is VERY helpful. Be specific as to what you are looking for (food type/quality, dress code, atmosphere, etc.) and you will be directed to some fantastic finds. Our preference is always exceptional food, more urban and a little less casual than 5 star. Honesty is the best policy and they did not let us down on this front. Cudos to the concierge. As an FYI - our stay in BC was from Aug 17 - Aug 27. The day we departed from the Four Seasons Vancouver - the Yew Restaurant was about to undergo a minor facelift. I'm guessing that has been completed but you may want to check on that if it will have an impact on your stay. Wish I were there to see it completed - I'm sure it looks fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “best place to stay downtown vancouver”
Reviews.Author: MurrayvilleMom
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I decided we wanted to get away from it all, and take a staycation in our own town. SO, after tweeting, and getting facebook recommendations from friends, we picked the Four Seasons. The hotel even tweeted me and asked if they could do anything for us! Wow! That is service! Perfect downtown location, all of the little details were taken care of and we felt pampered. Our beautiful room was clean, comfortable and we had a great sleep in the most comfy king size bed! We loved our view of the city as well. If you love to shop, well then I suggest you stay here. The Pacific Centre mall is right beside the hotel, with a door direct from the hotel to the mall! You are also super close to Robson Street shopping. A great place to stay whether you live in the city, or you are travelling from somewhere else. I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great service!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica N
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good things about this hotel. It's in the heart of the city, only one short stop from Rogers Arena. Made the trip to see the concert with the kids very easy & enjoyable. Thank you again for such a fabulous experience. The cookies with thier names on them were a memorable touch!

Reviews.Title: “Great service without pretentiousness”
Reviews.Author: Traveller5555
Reviews.Content: All of the staff very exceptionally 'real' and 'human' - great service but not pretentious.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: SouthamptonCarol
Reviews.Content: Next time we are in Vancouver we will be staying at the Four Seasons Hotel again. We were made to feel welcome from the minute we arrived and cannot fault the standards at this lovely hotel. The pool area and garden is a perfect place to start your day or to relax after a day of sightseeing. Vancouver is my favourite city in the world and the Four Seasons is now my favourite place to stay. The rooms are spacious and the beds comfy. The only small criticism is it can get a little noisy, but then the hotel is in a busy but convenient part of the city, so we couldn't leave the windows open at night. You could also hear people using their bathrooms at night, but this is a hotel with people coming and going, so it's to be expected. Other than these small things you get the best of service in lovely surroundings so please don't hesitate to book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best bed!!”
Reviews.Author: sidewalk1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons in May after attending a Vancouver Symphony Orchestra Concert. The room was everything one would expect of this calibre of hotel. Of all things, we were most impressed by the bed which was so very comfortable. We discoverd that they would arrange to purchase one on our behalf and have it delivered to our home (we live in Vancouver). Now how's that for service!! They made our special evening away from home outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Kelsey S
Reviews.Content: I was impressed as soon as we walked in. The service we received from check-in was absolutely amazing. The staff were so friendly and welcoming. I was very happy with the location and the walking distance to Rogers Arena. Located right above Pacific Centre and close to all the amazing restaurants. Wish we had stayed longer :) I advise on self-parking right underneath Pacific Centre ($6)

Reviews.Title: “Not the usual Four Seasons hotel”
Reviews.Author: FerWorld
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location in downtown Vancouver, and the service is impeccable, but the building itself, the decor, the ambience and the employees' uniforms are not up to the usual Four Seasons standards. The building needs a large-scale remodeling. The carpets are old, with fading colors and old-fashioned patterns. Floor tiles show their age, and shining brass everywhere (including mechanical stairs and elevators) reminded me of Vegas. Furniture in waiting areas and lobbies look worn out. The room where we stayed had old (not elegant) furniture and there was almost no artwork (pictures and/or paintings) on the walls. The bathroom was small, with low ceilings, and very old fixtures. The experience was ok, but certainly not what you would enjoy at other Four Seasons properties.

Reviews.Title: “Essence of Excellence”
Reviews.Author: Tom D
Reviews.Content: This is absolutely a great hotel considering everything about it. The suites overlooking the water and the mountaians in the background while you are having your breakfast in front of the wall to ceiling windows is just awesome. It is the kind of hotel where you would like to come back to time after time. The staff is wonderful and the location with the shopping mall just a step away is terrific. Tom Degefors

Reviews.Title: “Wished we could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: Susan Z
Reviews.Content: Loved the location of this hotel although it was a bit tricky to find by car as the address given. The valet parking is on the a different street which means we had to drive around the hotel and enter from the side. Check in was easy and quick and our bags arrived in our room promptly. Hotel was clean and the room was spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver luxury - look no further!!!”
Reviews.Author: vicdiva
Reviews.Content: What could be better than a luxury hotel with indoor/outdoor pool, well equipped exercise facility and ultra-knowledgeable staff - and built right overtop of a high-end shopping mall...AMAZING!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it & hope to return!”
Reviews.Author: REB0141
Reviews.Content: Probably our best overall experience in any hotel. Aside from the comfort, we dealt with the concierge desk. They were not only pleasant but extremely helpful in resolving our flight complications and arranging a personalized tour of Vancouver for the four of us traveling together. I cannot commend them enough for their patience and perserverence.

Reviews.Title: “Unintrusive best service ever. Great workout , hot tub, pool and restaurant. Pricey- yup but it IS the Four Seasons!”
Reviews.Author: starpilot1
Reviews.Content: You can indulge in breakfast in bed! As a single mom- I did! But save and go up the street to Crepes ??? On Robson. about 3 blocks away. For after 5! Yew bar rocks. Enjoy a unique mixology experience- the raw bar- the hot bar or even fries if you like. You can sit in Yew restaurant or communal style. Steak- - best thing here but fish/ scallops etc- good mix. Only wish more grilled/cooked lower cal things. Pool and fitness area is outstanding and kids are very welcome. Tykes can play while watched and you can work out on very good fitness equipment. It is close to everything. Indoors to Pacific Mall which has- an Apple Store as well as Harry Rosen - a walkway to Holt Renfrew

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and Service”
Reviews.Author: RealBetis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days before a cruise to Alaska. When we arrived from the airport the building was surrounded by emergency vehicles. It turns out that there was a chemical spill in the building's garage. When we checked in we were told that we could not enter our room (it was 5:30pm) because the our portion of the building had been evacuated. We were told to have a complimentary dinner in their restaurant while we waited. While this was a strange occurence, the hotel staff handled this situation very well and the free dinner was appreciated. During our dinner at Yew, a great restaurant that we enjoyed several times, staff gave us our room keys and told us that our room was available. We stayed in Deluxe Executive room, which consisted of a bedroom with a king bed, a living room and two bathrooms. It was a great room for a family of 4. The hotel left a number of treats for our kids along with kid's sized robes, which my kids loved. We found the room quiet and clean. We found service at the hotel very good. We used the concierge several times for advice and they were helpful. We also enjoyed their pool area that includes a half indoor and half outdoor pool. The location was very convenient to all of the sites in town. We would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastice Hotel & Staff”
Reviews.Author: RustyDAstros
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. The Valet, Front Desk, Concierge and Restaurant staff were all very pleasant and helpful with directions, recommendations for sightseeing and restaurants. We had wonderful clean rooms with plush towels, soaps and soft sheets. Each evening with turndown service the housekeeping staff brought ice and replaced all used towels and emptied all trash. The housekeeping staff was great and very friendly. The rooms did not have in room coffee makers, but in the lobby there was coffee, pastries and fruit for guest. Guest had their choice of what news paper they wanted and the business center was nice and easy to use. The restaurant staff was very attentive and helpful with food selections and special requests. The food was great and the dessert trio was nice way to try small samples of dessert. We suggest the lollypop dessert. It was fantastic. The hotel was within walking distance to great restaurants, shopping and sights. We felt very safe in the area of town the hotel was located in. This was the best hotel out of the 5 hotels we stayed in during our two week vacation to Washington and British Columbia. Highly recommend this hotel to families, business and great away travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I had stayed here”
Reviews.Author: CAKarenOrangeCounty
Reviews.Content: I have to admit I stayed across the street at the Rosewood Georgia...however we ate lunch twice and breakfast once at the Four Seasons. I thought I was getting a deal on my room at the Rosewood - but I was traveling with my 2 teenage sons and the Executive Suite would not accommodate all of us (the couch did not open to a bed). So I ended up with 2 connecting rooms - which was probably just as pricey. We ate at the Four Seasons because, as usual, they are so accommodating. My 15 year old is a picky eater and wanted steak and fries for lunch. The second day we ate lunch we had a different waiter but our first waiter had already informed him of his preference. Wonderful service, inviting, accommodating...as always the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel; great price”
Reviews.Author: RH_Travellors
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for for a few nights and had a great experience. Typical Four Seasons experience. Very personal touch. Nice clean comfortable rooms. Only observation is that the restaurant should open sooner. Many guests arrive and are still on eastern time and it would be nice to get breakfast before 7am (10 eastern). Fairmont down the street understands this and is open for breakfast earlier.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel F&B, Concierge and Fitness exceeded my expectations on all scores!”
Reviews.Author: Traci M
Reviews.Content: They went above and beyond to exceed my expectations for a specific set of special requests made. A wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: ccarny
Reviews.Content: The huge but inviting lobby provided a very favorable impression. The restaurant/bar was cozy and the service excellent. The room proved to be what a nice hotel can offer. Large, great view and very clean. We greatly enjoyed our stay in the Four Seasons

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: ginauf
Reviews.Content: i was in vancouver for siggraph and this was a great location. the neighborhood was very nice (in between the hotel and the convention center were stores like Cartier...so you know the location isn't shabby). to get to the hotel from the airport was a breeze. you just hop on the Canada Line, get off at the Vancouver Centre Station stop, and you're basically across the street from the hotel ($8.75 from the airport, $3.75 back to the airport - there is a $5 origination charge from the airport). check in was easy, the room was pretty standard - i had a "city view" - king bed, desk, TV, full bath, closet, & a safe. the room was serviced 2x/day, was very clean and had l'occitane products in the bathroom - i'm really picky about using hotel products, but these were great and didn't dry out my hair or skin. you could hear street noise and seagulls, but what do you expect from being in a highrise close to the water. to get to the convention center, siggraph had shuttles going to/from the hotel, but the walk was only ~6 blocks, the weather was nice, and there were 4 starbucks (and a bunch of other restaurants in between) so i walked everyday and it was quite pleasant. Gasstown is an easy walk from the hotel as well and with such a convenient trainstop location, you can get around pretty easily. the concierge was great - they gave me maps and recommendations for what to do. the hotel also exchanged some money for me, and had postcards and stamps for sale (which i always send back to my niece and nephew). when it came to check out, they had 2 locations to print out your boarding passes which was easy and free. overall - a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “All around great hotel”
Reviews.Author: VAtraveller17
