Reviews.Content: I can't think of a thing wrong with this hotel. The staff were attentive and service oriented. The YEW restaurant had good food and was accommodating to our young children (4 and 2). The rooms were nicely appointed as were the bathrooms. The pool is 1/2 inside and 1/2 outside with complimentary tea/coffee/water. The kids loved the pool as did the grown ups. We found the staff very accommodating to our kids - they even have kid's sized robes and when we arrived they had a tray in the bathroom of child amenity items. The hotel is within walking distance of the shopping district and some historical sites, but a bit of a haul if you plan on walking to Stanley Park (I'd recommend a cab). The concierge was very helpful recommending we buy aquarium tickets through them in advance. I'm always leery of this, but did it and was glad I did - we got to skip the long line and walk right in. Warning for families or parties of 4 or more: While we loved Vancouver, the cab rules on number of passengers is absurd. No more than 4 passengers in a cab. They do have mini-van cabs - but it is up to the driver whether they will take more than 4. My mini-van (the same as most of the cabs I saw) easily sits 7 with cargo, but they are rule followers! The secret when ordering a mini-van cab is to say you only have 4 passengers. We never had an actual cab driver refuse us when they showed up and we had 5 (including small children), but the cab companies will not send one if you tell them you have more than 4 or they will send two. The hotel staff seemed to sympathize with us on the cab rules as did the restaurant staff at a place we ate, but rules are rules - or a racket is a racket. Overall if I was to stay in Vancouver again (and we intend to, it is a fabulous city) we would definitely consider the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “A Hilton with Four Seasons service”
Reviews.Author: schvitz
Reviews.Content: This property struck us as a rebranded 4-star. It's older and larger than the urban FS properties we have stayed at, and is perhaps 1960s vintage. Our first stay was in an executive suite which, though comfortable, struck us as somewhat institutional. Our second stay was in a premier room, and was is more like the kind of room we have come to expect in a FS. The pool is very nice for an urban property, about 18 m long [I guess], and suitable for lap swims. The gym, too, was well-equipped and pleasant. The restaurant was excellent, and we highly recommend the prix-fixe dinner. The space, recently renovated, is most pleasant. Service was, as expected at FS, unpretentious and professional. Our server, David, was especially fine and provided a wine suggestion that proved to be delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Another great vacation experience”
Reviews.Author: How_now_brown_Cao
Reviews.Content: Pros: Fantastic staff, good location Cons: I just don't have enough money to live there! I've never had a bad experience at a Four Seasons, but the staff was particularly gracious during this vacation. A member of my family--staying alone in a separate room--became ill. Unfortunately, this incident occurred while a member of the housekeeping staff was tending to the room (my family member was in the washroom, door closed). Later that afternoon, the housekeeper delivered a care package to my mother-in-law with ginger ale and other "tummy ache" items. In the evening, the front desk called her to see if she required the house physician. How fantastic is that?! My family member felt fine and didn't require the service of a doctor, but we appreciate the Four Seasons going that extra mile. Additionally, they have a blow-dry only salon in the lobby. The ladies out there understand the importance of a good blow-out and it comes at a reasonable price. Love the Four Seasons!

Reviews.Title: “welcoming”
Reviews.Author: jbritishtraveller
Reviews.Content: the moment we walked through the door.we were treated like royalty.the staff are wonderful.the hotel is wonderful.just wonderful

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: david255060
Reviews.Content: my wife and I spent 3 nights at this hotel and loved it. The location is very good in hte heart of the city and walking distance to many of the sights in the city. The subway is easily reached from the hotel. But more importantly the staff are terrific, without exception we found them to be friendly, helpful and knowledgable about things to do and see in Vancouver. If we ever get back to Vancouver wouldn't stay anywhere else

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay; without qualification. Also enjoyed the Yew Restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: ianfmc
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay at the Four Season in Vancouver. Staff was exceptionally friendly and professional, and the room was perfect. I would highly recommend the hotel to anyone staying in Vancouver. (I can't comment on the value per se because I was able to use a corporate rate). This may be my new favorite in Vancouver, and there are many excellent hotels here!

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons service in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: allidoistravel
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in two suites in August. Service is what sets Four Seasons hotels apart and we were not disappointed. From arrival through departure we were coddled. The suites were serviced a number of times throughout the day and evening and no request was ignored or forgotten. Staff were friendly and efficient. We'll return here when the occasion arises.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: RetiredHawkeye
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a conference rate which was quite reasonable and included internet service at no extra charge. The hotel was very accommodating in allowing us an early check-in so we could dispose of luggage before walking downtown for a bus tour. The room was quite spacious even with a king size bed and was nicely decorated in gold and cream. We were able to use the bar refrigerator for juice boxes. It was an easy walk both to downtown Canada Place and Robson Street. It would have been nice to have an electric hot pot for making tea. The staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The only downside during the summer, is that the place is crawling with obnoxious Americans going on Alaska cruises.”
Reviews.Author: afbunn
Reviews.Content: The rooms are beautiful, comfortable, quiet and clean. Housekeeping is perfect. The restaurant is, unfortunately part of the bar and not conducive to conversation or romance but the food is very good. It would be great to have a fine dining option in the hotel, because the service (which is top notch) and chef's skills would make a better dining venue here a great success. There are very few fine dining restaurants in Vancouver and it gets tiring to share a nice evening out with people who wear jeans or baseball caps for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “I would consider this property a Three Seasons, at best”
Reviews.Author: Air_Koryo
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night as part of a tourism promo. Room rate was $100 so I believe we were booked into one of the lowest-grade rooms reserved for deep discounts and Priceline customers. Although the hotel showed evidence of being in a high-end property, it was tired and needed a full facelift: crappy window treatments a thin layer of dust over many surfaces old furniture gilded and brass lobby, 80's-style HOWEVER, the restaurant Yew will punch you right in the sack with its deliciousness. One caveat: my wife asked for two glasses of champagne to be waiting at our table upon arrival (special occasion), so, of course, the most expensive stuff sold by the glass was poured ($32/glass). The food rocks, service is great, dining room is beautiful. Just be sure you are wealthy and attractive enough to do this restaurant right! Hotel staff were pretty great, near FS full-calibre, but not enough to make us consider booking again at regular rates. This property seems more like a Sheraton than a FS but for $100, the price was about right.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed, not what the FS standard.”
Reviews.Author: travelmedstudent
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with family after a personal business trip. The room was nice, and clean so no complaints there. The biggest complaint being that everything is just so old. You'd be better to stay at the Shangri-la a few blocks away (which looked a lot nicer and is newly renovated/built). The location is nice, as well as the pool area. The building itself is old and outdated, they are in serious need of renovating the whole complex. The rooms do smell damp, possible mildew, the curtains are old, the windows throughout the whole hotel were dirty, what use is having a room with a view if you look out and see stained, water deposit windows, that was a big disappointment. Overall, it's just not worth the money you're spending you could spend the same amount of money and get something a lot better. As far as concierge, they were fine, the standard, very close to the art gallery. The doormen also weren't very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “So disappointing”
Reviews.Author: newyorkgal07
Reviews.Content: We are crazy Four Seasons fans but this property simply doesn't measure up. It is reminiscent of the late 1970s with dark wood paneling and very sharp angles--reminds me of the Brady Bunch house and is very outdated! The hotel can't seem to decide if it's a luxury hotel, a family resort, or a party spot. The game room for kids off of the lobby was overflowing with noisy kids. The room next to us was full of a group of guys clearly in town to party--and not sleep! A cruise group came through as did some back packers. The hotel restaurant was overwhelmed and understaffed. The concierge seemed to only recommend attractions and restaurants featured on tourist maps--not very original and they quickly ran out of recommendations for us. The pool area is okay but since it's not on the top floor, all you see are the nearby office buildings--pretty dreary. We would not stay here again. We always choose a Four Seasons if available when traveling so this was a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Quite tired - shame”
Reviews.Author: MarkH1964London
Reviews.Content: We had been told - wrongly - by our check-out agent at the Four Seasons in San Francisco that the Vancouver property had recently been renovated. This is not true. The hotel, although clean with good service, is tired and malodorous. The accommodation is not up to the standard of the FS. The furnishings and fabrics are old and somewhat outdated. Curtain rails are visible and leak light. Bathrooms are small and dingy, with low ceilings, tiny sinks - and we have one that's cracked. The bathrooms are missing the usual FS separate tub-shower-lavatory-double sink layout. Worst of all is the smell. At first, you think it's smoke but I think it's aging and damp. We complained and were upgraded to a lovely smelling room - which was a very kind gesture - but, on our return, we noticed that the room had exactly the same smell as the first one. Clearly, they just sent in the housekeeper with a bottle of Febreze. We will post again when we have seen more of the place, but our first impressions are not good.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: stellamAuckland
Reviews.Content: Overall probably the nicest hotel I have been in. We are a NZ family of 3 adults in Vancouver for a conference. We booked a suite on the 22 nd floor. This gave us separate sleeping on a sofa sleeper for my adult daughter , but no kitchen facilities. Two bathrooms and excellent outlook towards Canada Place and the water. The staff at this hotel have been superbly trained and nothing was too much trouble. Excellent checkin,cheery helpful service from Cole and the team at the front door, and fantastic help with restaurants and bookings from the lovely Leah, Lauren and Letitia and others in the concierge team. The housemaids were unintrusive and our rooms were cleaned to a very high standard. The hotel position is good, the room furnishings very nice including a wonderful bed. The sofas sleeper was improved by a bed board. There was no need for a car, taxis were readily available and cheap and also public transport is easy in Vancouver. Didn't love the breakfast, but the bar is lovely and a nice meal eaten in the restaurant one night. Also enjoyed the swimming pool and gymn area and had a lovely bento lunch there one day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Pool & Roof Deck”
Reviews.Author: Oaklandish3
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent stay here. I was upgraded to a suite which was great. Although the furnishings seemed a little drab and dated - not up to the usual Four Seasons standards, the room was immaculate and extremely comfortable. The best things about this hotel is its location in central downtown across from the Vancouver Art Gallery, the restaurant and the amazing roof deck and pool. I didn't use the pool which is an indoor/outdoor pool and fitness room this trip but the deck is huge, beautifully landscaped and with lots of comfortable seating. I spent several hours enjoying a beautiful day relaxing on the deck. The hotel's restaurant is also super - the best breakfast I have had in Vancouver and a great bar area. The only negative was the $12 per day wi-fi charge which is ridiculous when you're paying top dollar for a room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in VanCity, with great location.”
Reviews.Author: KCam21
Reviews.Content: The thing that separates this hotel from some of the other new luxury hotels that have opened in Vancouver recently is the exceptional Four Seasons service. I am a loyal Four Seasons customer and always will be. Although this property is a little dated compared to some of their others, the service is impeccable. On one occasion they knew it was my birthday and upon arrivle had a cake waiting in the room. Like I said before, the hotel is a little dated, however they recently went through a multimillion dollar renovation. This allowed them to update all rooms and common areas. The lobby is beautiful and understated, as are the knew furnishings in each guestroom/suite (big improvement in the bathrooms). Overall the hotel has greatly improved its overall look in the past few years, while maintaining that FS standard of excellence in service. If you're looking to dine at the hotel, room service is a must (no matter what time of day). In addition to the room service there is the trendy YEW restaurant in the lobby, they have a good selection of dining options, and offer an upscale atmosphere. You will find the young, jetset, and goodlooking as a the regular clientele. The added bonus of staying at the Four Seasons is the location of the property. It is situated right atop the Pacific Centre, and although this may seem like a nightmare to some, as it gets packed with people after 2pm, it does offer the luxury retailer Holt Renfrew at the one end of the centre. The Van art gallery is right across the street, along with a number of good restaurants and shops (Robson/Burrard St.) Overall I would strongly recommend this hotel as one of the best luxury hotels currently in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very clean”
Reviews.Author: MoDivinOttawa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located perfectly on West Georgia, downtown Vancouver. It is very close proximity to all the great shopping on Robson, as well as a short walk to the waterfront where you can stroll along the seawall and go to some nice restaurants. The staff is very helpful and friendly and the rooms are very well appointed. In fact, the beds and pillows are so comfy, I bought the pillows to bring home! ;-) This hotel is also attached to the Pacific Centre which is a nice mall with tons of great stores-- great when it is rainy and you don't want to venture outside. The gym and fitness centre with the indoor/outdoor pool is beautiful and clean, and the complimentary coffee/fruit bar is a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “We've stayed in alot of different hotels. This was the best by far.”
Reviews.Author: gohde16
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic stay. Everything and everyone employed by this hotel went above and beyond. This hotel deserves 6 stars!!! Don't miss the award winning pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Two very nice days in Vancouver with kids”
Reviews.Author: spep4
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights with our three kids. This is a very nice hotel, as you'd expect. The restAurant was excellent both for breakfast and lunch. The hotel is well located so it's easy to walk around town and cab to various attractions. The staff was great. The rooms are a bit old style, rather than modern like some other FS properties, but very nice. Overall, definitely didn't let us down.

Reviews.Title: “Lap of luxury”
Reviews.Author: MCrash
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous room with two full marble washrooms and french doors separating bedroom from living room. Started each morning at the health centre - what a beautiful place!

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: JRLWinnipegCanada
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, amazing service and great location. Food is delicious and the staff is second to none.

Reviews.Title: “completely underwelmed”
Reviews.Author: WWKY
Reviews.Content: It is a Four Seasons and it is a five star...but it is not living up to it. Don't get me wrong, it is a clean, professionally ran, but basic hotel. Another hotel that is living off its legacy but current state. The room we were in was facing Metropolitan hotel, i.e. no view (I get it, it is downtown). And, somehow the ceiling of our room has beams all long the 4 walls which made it feel like a basement. Very little light too... Once the Rosewood across the street is finished, Four Seasons will have be under a lot more pressure to update this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel in vancouver - great location and service”
Reviews.Author: konadog1
Reviews.Content: This is a fine hotel. Vancouver is a beautiful city and the hotel matches. I was here for a conference, and had a large room. The internet wasn't free, but it allowed three devices to connect, saving me a lot over the two days. I'd definitely come back. The room was very quiet too.

Reviews.Title: “The staff goes above and beyond.”
Reviews.Author: TravellinKen
Reviews.Content: YEW Restaurant & Bar is simply excellent on so many levels. Rooms are ultra comfortable, Hotel is located in a prime location, and the staff is incredible

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best hotel for its price!”
Reviews.Author: Triplover068
Reviews.Content: Absolutely everything was great. Only one comment - no complimentary Wi-Fi service in the room, which make the hotel a bit inconvenient for young visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay for our family of 4”
Reviews.Author: patart123
Reviews.Content: Our stay was perfect. Our room was a deluxe suite with two bathrooms on the 28th floor. Having the extra room for our pre-teens after two weeks of sharing one room and bath was a treat. View was a great combo of city with a water backdrop. Kids eat for free which is a nice plus. The Yew restaurant was excellent as was the service there and everywhere in the hotel. Pool area is beautiful and very clean. Valet parking is $41 (after taxes) per night. There was a self-park option which was less especially on the weekends as this hotel is in the financial district. We enjoyed walking down Howe Street to the harbor/cruise ship area but were glad we did not choose to stay in a one of the hotels in the midst of that busy area. My daughter and I enjoyed shopping in the attached shopping mall.

Reviews.Title: “As Always, Stellar service and a beautiful room!”
Reviews.Author: KT_Couture
Reviews.Content: Any time I go to Vancouver I like to stay at the Four Seasons. The staff is wonderful, and I love that they treat my dog just as well as they treat me!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: mamadebbie34229
Reviews.Content: From the bell hop to the doorman and everyone in between, so very helpful! The room was spotless, the bed extremely comfortable, and the restaurant was just what we needed for a yummy breakfast. The hotel is located around many excellent restaurants and stores. Vancouver is a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel I choose when I go to Vancouver for business”
Reviews.Author: Muguet10
Reviews.Content: Large room with a comfortable bed. Staff is very dedicated to clients comfort Swimming pool is always clean and at the right temperature.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for 1 night getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Mudder386
Reviews.Content: Loved the print out service for boarding passes. The internet was expensive, is free in some hotels. Ordered popcorn and pizza as room service, came to the room with a table, linens and silverware!

Reviews.Title: “Not What You'd Expect From the Four Seasons Chain”
Reviews.Author: thats-kandy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last month for a week of fun in Vancouver. It is centrally located which was why I picked this hotel. We are avid travelers and have stayed at a wide range of hotel chains and this was our first with the Four Seasons. I was excited because I expected the hotel to be awesome. I was taken for a surprise and not in a good way. The hotel was older and you can definitely tell by its current state. Our hotel room was a comfortable size but the tables in the room were extremely dusty and I noticed this as soon as we arrived. Upon my arrival I noticed that the lamp shades on the side tables were crooked. This may not be a big deal for most but remember…..this is the Four Seasons you are staying at. The decor was old and the restroom could use some updating. I used their swimming pool once and it too could use some work. It leads outside to the terrace where there were trees whose leaves had blown into the pool and left there. The pool is in the same room as the fitness area with no dividers which made it uncomfortable. I have stayed at the Sheraton chain many times and was more impressed by it than by this hotel. Besides being centrally located, nothing else sets this hotel apart from any other lower end hotels in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Top choice for Vancouver stay”
Reviews.Author: sdhanson
Reviews.Content: If you ever get the chance to stay at the Four Seasons in Vancouver, take it. It's not always the most affordable choice - in fact, we stayed here for a conference and paid just C$185 per night - but it is worth it for the impeccable service and facilities. We would return here anytime!

Reviews.Title: “The worst Four Seasons.”
Reviews.Author: Shibuyakko
Reviews.Content: We, family of 3, stayed in a gold executive suite for 3 nights and we regret choosing this hotel. This was our first time in Vancouver and we chose this hotel thinking," We can't go too wrong with a Four Seasons," but we did. The hotel is old and dated. It needs a serious renovation. Our room was spacious with two bathrooms but it was musty, the furniture was old and uncomfortable for sitting. The bathrooms were small, the tubs small, the water flow in the shower feeble and we had to use the blow dryer to clear the steam off the mirror. The gold executive suite didn't have a coffee maker, no complimentary water -- $7.50 each for the two bottles thoughtfully left on the bureau top -- and the wireless was not free. They had a coffee station in the lobby in the morning, but it ended at 8am. They had very small take-out coffee cups and tiny pastries in small numbers which were slow to be refilled. Very reminiscent of a Hampton Inn. Nothing against the Hampton Inn, but I don't think they pretend to be 5-star. After the first day, we opted for Starbucks which was right across the street. If you're going to do coffee stand, do it right! The location is great and the concierge service is good, but with all new great hotels opening around town, I'm afraid the Four Seasons falls a season short. We were expecting much more from a gold executive suite at a Four Season's for 585 CAD+/night. We would certainly not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay. small room. fancy toiletries. has a pool. it is small. and half outside”
Reviews.Author: FredShuuz
Reviews.Content: service: very good. if you wanted, they would clean your room in the am , and have bed turndown service at night concierge was helpful directing us room: clean. comfortable bed. on the small side. internet was included good downtown location. short walk to the convention centre fancy toiletries. there's a computer just for printing out your boarding pass gym: some machines, they have daily free aerobics classes. went to a session and got a private workout with the trainer.. pool is not too small however you swim outside for half of it. and in April in vancouver it can be chilly outside

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: Canberra_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel at 10am after a 24 hour flight and was offered a room straight away. It put us in a very good mood for the rest of our 3 day stay. Staff were professional everywhere in the hotel - helpful, knowledgeable and seemed very well trained. We loved dining in Yew which we thought offered excellent value. We also thought that despite the hotel maybe needing an upgrade in certain areas in the near future, the prices charged at the moment offered us really good value. The professionalism was very refreshing.

Reviews.Title: “Best service ever”
Reviews.Author: drdan0113
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel and I was very impressed with the service. I have never seen such friendly an helpful staff before. Even though it is a big hotel , the people who worked there greeted me by the name always. The rooms are luxurious and the hotel has a nice pool and restaurant. It is located on top of the pacific mall , so its great for shopping. Its also about a 10min walk from the waterfront. The Canada line entrance is also right next to the hotel. The only problem with the hotel is, is that it does not have a see view, but I guess the location makes up for that if you are there for business or shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Very central!”
Reviews.Author: Gifu
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located with 2 skytrain stations under the hotel: Granville & Van. Centre. You are only a short walk from everything (Robson, waterfront, bars). Check-in/out were quick and easy. Our room was checked/cleaned 2x a day. Free newspaper everyday. No complimentary water. A couple of things annoyed me. The curtains don't cover all of the window, leaving a slit of sunlight thru. Once the sun is out, you'll know it. When you come back to the hotel, you can't access the elevators from the ground floor, but have to go all the way back to the lobby. The lobby wasn't impressive, for a 5*. When it's quiet, you can hear the skytrain, but that's the price of convenience. The hotel's restaurant is very popular and has a good rep. (looked amazing). Didn't try it but I would definitely dine there next time. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice as Expected”
Reviews.Author: GIMD
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and welcoming to families. Used the "kids in the city" package to get guaranteed connecting rooms, with the second room at 50% off. Great service, location, and rooms overall. I thought the bathrooms were sort of small for a 5-star hotel but it is probably just a reflection of when the hotel was built. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Understated Luxury”
Reviews.Author: John5259
Reviews.Content: I am a Travel Agent in Brisbane and have stayed in 236 Hotels in 101 Cities in 38 Countries. So I feel I am in a position to know the difference between an average, good, and excellent hotel. We stayed here for three nights in April, in a deluxe room on the twenty second floor. Check-in went smoothly, the staff being friendly and efficient. The room afforded good views, and was very comfortable. The King Bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was quite small, but well appointed. Shower in Bath. We were amazed to find that there were no Coffee / Tea making facilities in the room. We soon discovered though, in the mornings, adjacent to the Elevators in the Lobby, there is help-yourself Coffee and Tea that you can take back to your room. Included in this are pastries. All complimentary of course. We actually thought this was a good idea. I'm sure Housekeeping think so too! Housekeeping were good, the room was always kept very clean. We only had the one meal in the hotel, a dinner in their only restaurant. The service was great, and so was the food. The hotel is in a great location, right in the centre, within easy walking distance to all the places a tourist wants to see. Except of course the Capilano Suspension Bridge and Grouse Mountain. The concierge was most helpful, friendly, and efficient. Although not being "perfect", (What hotel ever is) I would have to say this hotel deserves its Five Star rating. We had a most comfortable and enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: LauraP186338
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons in Vancouver was a very nice hotel. The room was clean and modern and quite stylish and it was well located for the main sites. We also had a very good view out of the windows which were floor length. There was a very nice cocktail bar in the hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Fabulous Management”
Reviews.Author: rlk33853
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a number of different times and each time everything has been great. This time though I did have a problem at the health club - I say health club because that it what it is, not the usual hotel gym. Full gym equipment and aerobic equipment - unfortunately this includes outside the hotel patrons and personal trainers. The personal trainer that morning appropriated a portion of the gym, including a bench and the cable machine so that the indiividual who he was training, would not have to wait during his workout. When the individual was using one, the trainer would stand in the way of the other piece of equipment. Even when I asked to use the equipment the trainer stayed in the way. After my workout I attended the front desk and made my concerns known. I assured the day manager that all the hotel staff were fabulous, with this one exception. The day manager immediately took action and assured me that she would look into the situation and inform me of the results. Which she did. Later that day I received a call outlining that she had spoken with the trainer - and clarified that hotel guests had priority to the Four Seasons Health Club and should be afforded the luxury of using the faciility without delays caused by outside users. The next day I received another call - this time from the Hotel General Manager - ensuring that I was happy with the situation. The next day I received yet another call - this time from the Regional Manager who let me know how much they appreciated bringing this to the hotel's attention. Basically a minor problem was handled not only to my satisfaction, but management made absolutely sure that I maintained my satisfaction with their property. The hotel staff during my visits, both in the past and in this case, are among the very best I have ever seen. All that said, the hotel management has now surpassed anything I have ever experienced. Overall - Great job!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel sets the bar very very high”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth_KCC
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived, I was treated like an honoured guest. From the doorman who greeted me by name as I emerged from the car to the desk staff who welcomed me and walked me to the elevator, to Winnie and the rest of the concierge team who ensured that I had all information at my disposal, I felt from my first engagement with the Four Seasons as if I was a regular visitor, and was being welcomed back. The evening room refresh, with lights and radio on when I arrived following a full day of touring and enjoying the city, allowed me to settle comfortably for the evening. Our experiences at lunch and dinner at Yew were truly second to none; this is a a world class team, offering world class service!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: frenchie0621
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. I have never slept on a bed that comfy! The hotel is located right in the middle of downtown with everything nearby. Obviously it is a little more expensive but you are at the Four Seasons, that is expected... The staff was so welcomming and friendly, polite and courteous and would go all ways to help you and make your stay most enjoyable. I would recommend the Four Seasons in Vancouver to anyone who wants to travel in luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive wifi”
Reviews.Author: Russell63
Reviews.Content: If you need wifi you will be charged about $15.00 a day for it; I'm told that is because it is a special high speed version! This cost is non-negotiable. Walk down the street a few minutes and stay at the Hotel Vancouver Fairmont - if you sign up prior to arrival for the President's club then your wifi is free....and just as fast. Nice hotel and staff too!

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: shimmykim
Reviews.Content: It definitely is not the nicest Four Seasons that I have visited, but it is definitely the cheapest. We were able to get a great package deal and really enjoyed our short stay. The location was great, very central. The rooms were clean and elegant, but not extravagent. They have a nice gym and pool facility. The service was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “A little dated, but clean and great service!”
Reviews.Author: Fawcettinc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little aged, rooms are clean and include all the normal four seasons amenities! There is a half indoor/outdoor pool, which has a bar to grab a drink. Service was typical four seasons and excellant! Location was great and is connected to a upper class mall, so there is plenty of dining and shopping options very close. Would gp back for the great service!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Good Location.”
Reviews.Author: longleggedlizard
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in February. On arrival we were given a complimentary upgrade to a suite which was very nice. We didn't have much interaction with the staff, but when we did they were always polite and pleasant. The room was spacious and clean, likewise the bathrooms (we had two in the suite). The hotel is in a good location to explore most things in downtown, and is right opposite the Canada Line Station so getting to/from Vancouver Airport is easy and inexpensive. We ate out all the time so can't comment on the food at the hotel. I would definitely stay here and definitely recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but getting old. Pool was a nice change in winter.”
Reviews.Author: Plow9
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week with my wife and young daughter. It is a good hotel, but in need of a makeover, it's getting rather dated. I only have a small complaint about the staff on check-in. I'd just flown in on a long flight from London and wanted to go to my room to sleep. My company had booked the room and provided a credit card for the booking. However the clerk insisted I provide another credit card until he could confirm that my company was picking up the charges, which I did. However my corporate card was not working when he tried to charge $2000 to it. Why they need to charge that much at check-in is beyond me, especially when he has the card that is going to be used for the booking on file. Anyway, after arguing with them I had to provide a personal card for him to pre-authorise the $2k. I hate doing this because it locks up personal funds, and it is a nightmare to get re-imbursed by my company later. Anyway long story short, the idiots ended up charging my personal card for the entire trip and had to issue a refund later and charge my company card as they had been instructed to do initially. It was very annoying and totally un-necessary. Not what I call exceptional service... The room was fine, apart from the fact they can only provide two double beds in a room and not two queens. A double bed is just too small, even for a 2yr old child and an adult to sleep in as we did. I don't know why any hotel would even bother with double sized beds anymore. Normal sized people just cannot sleep comfortably in them. The pool and fitness centre was a nice surprise. It has an indoor and outdoor component. The fitness centre also provided dumbells, which is becoming rare and is very much welcomed by anyone who works out regularly. Another annoying thing is that they lock access to the lifts from the bottom level for some unknown reason. Sometimes the bell staff were there to give access, but mostly you had to catch the escalator to the next level, then the lift from there - annoying when you have a child in a pram. Guests should be able to access these lifts with key/swipe access, but it looks like the hotel and lifts are too old to have this technology. It is still a nice hotel, but next time I'll be trying the Fairmont instead.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons is just... Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: Paris_Hongkong
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights there, as they offered this excellent package where one night is offered for two nights spent: that alone made it a pretty good deal. So for us the first positive point was the value for money. The location of the hotel is absolutely central, very close to Robson St, and it gives direct access to a mall, pretty convenient for shopping (without being too busy or noisy, of course). It's also not far form the subway station. The restaurant is pretty tasty, it seems local executives use it for business lunches and as after work lounge. Minor point is they kind of "promote" as having a Spa service, but it turns out it's located a block away: not really practical, and not very "luxury" for a Four Seasons hotel... not to mention the staffs there were a bit arrogant too.

Reviews.Title: “Time for a makeover”
Reviews.Author: petereturra
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of its well rated restaurant, good central city location and the Four Seasons brand always has good hotels. The hotel is not in the same league as any other Four Seasons hotels we have visited. Staff were very good, Yew restaurant was very good - and for these reasons and its location I rate it 4 stars. The room we had was comfortable but very ordinary (not five star level), the bathroom looked as though it was designed for very short people or young children, the foyer is rather unstylish - looks like 1970's and not much work done on it since then (except the restaurant which is a nice style and obviously has been refurbished in recent times).

Reviews.Title: “The only place we stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: DeanpW
Reviews.Content: We've been coming to Vancouver for more than 10 years and the Four Seasons is the only place we stay. I'm sure there are other fine hotels, but why change when it's so good. It's almost a cliche but the service is pretty much flawless--welcoming and solicitous without being fawning. The beds are divine and rooms are a bit larger than normal for big-city hotels. The Yew restaurant has solid West Coast cuisine and is a great improvement on Chartwell's, the previous hotel restaurant. The indoor-outdoor pool is a big attraction for us, as is the direct entrance to the Pacific Place shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “Its always home coming”
Reviews.Author: mathans
Reviews.Content: Absolutely our Favourite hotel in Vancouver. Something with Vancouver specially the people out here are very friendly, calm and polite. Very clean city and beautiful. We have stayed here before and everytime the staff and service is fantastic. Most of their staff seems to be there for long. Room service here is outstanding too.

Reviews.Title: “We became regular customers at the restaurant as the food was excellent”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaJEL
Reviews.Content: This is another four seasons with excellent service All the staff were friendly and welcoming. We were given free bottled water when we took our car out. The business centre had free internet but it would be nice if that was extended to the rooms. The Yew Restaurant had great food.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, almost great service”
Reviews.Author: meglara
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons hotel for 3 days in Sept 2010. The hotel is in a great location for exploring downtown Vancouver. The rooms were very nice, large, clean and comfortable. Our only hiccup was the room reservation. We had booked a couple of months in advance for a specific room type/size, and when we arrived we were informed that they were sold out of these and that they could only offer us a regular room. We had no choice but to accept this. They did kind of make it ok in the end by offering to pay for our breakfast on our last day ($80). They were very occomodating with our other requests, including storing a painting. We usually stay with Fairmont when in Vancouver, so this was a little bit of a let down on our first stay at the Four Seasons, but overall the hotel made up for the mistake with everything else it offers. As a side note, the Blo Bar in the lobby is totally worth the stop for the ladies to get their hair done!

Reviews.Title: “A good arrangement”
Reviews.Author: Gardolina
Reviews.Content: Class hotel. Good pool. Pleasant service. Very much it was pleasant in it. Tasty rolls in buffet. A good arrangement

Reviews.Title: “Just a 3.5 Seasons at best...”
Reviews.Author: Rossvegas12345
Reviews.Content: I just spent 4 nights at this hotel, and i have to say that I was definitely a little undewhelmed. It's not that the hotel isn't "nice" - it certainly is - but some of the things I encountered simply have me shaking my head... Let's start with the in-room internet. The hotel offers two options: painfully SLOW internet (useful for email, Twitter and Facebook updates) for $11.99 per day, and relatively FAST internet (capable of streaming video, etc.) for $16.99. WTF? This is supposed to be a FOUR SEASONS HOTEL...who in their right mind would opt for dial-up quality internet, and why would you even offer that to your guests? (If you're going to go that route, why not offer a "scratchy, ripped bed sheet offer" for $30 less per night?) More importantly, why are they still charging for it? Most business-friendly hotels now offer conveniences such as free WiFi, free local phone calls, coffee in the rooms...but this place offers NONE of that. Phone calls are still charged at $1.55 each, coffee is unavailable (unless you're willing to mortgage your house and pay room service something like $10 per cup), and the aforementioned two-tier internet is simply mind boggling. (Parking is $29 per day.) The kicker was seeing a 1 litre bottle of "Whistler Water" on the dresser with a $7.50 price tag on it. Really? Dear Four Seasons: People are paying you $200 + to sleep in your rooms, and you can't GIVE them a bottle of water? Would the $1.29 decimate your ROI or REVPAR...or would it leave a nice taste in your residual clientele's mouths? That's just dumb management in my books, and if you want to present yourself as a "classy" hotel, you should start by showing a little class yourself. As it sits, I was left with the impression that the hotel was moochy, and that it survived by nickel and diming people to death - not cool. When the front desk clerk asked me if I enjoyed my stay, my response was: "Well, it's kind of like my mother's perfume. It's not entirely unpleasant, and it was probably very nice back in its DAY... but it doesn't turn me on in the least." That's the Four Seasons Vancouver: it's your mother's perfume. In my opinion, this hotel is really out of touch with today's reality. There are several very nice boutique hotels in Vancouver that "get it", but this hotel is still living in the 90's and there are (apparently) enough people out there who are perfectly fine with that. I'm just stunned that they are SO behind the curve, and I would suggest that they realize (sooner rather than later) that their esteemed brand name is only going to take them so far.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice but needs attention to some details”
Reviews.Author: Jaquesspratt
Reviews.Content: Although quite familiar with Vancouver and the major hotels there, this was our first stay at the Four Seasons. We booked a standard room , and did well with our city view on the 28th floor. The room was standard size, with a king size bed, a large screen HD TV with many channels and the usual desk phones etc. The manual temperature setting functioned well. The bed and pillows were amazingly comfortable, as expected at the Four Seasons. The bathroom was a disappointment, with cold ceramic floor, a small tub with a hinged glass wall part way down the tub to protect the floor from shower use. To get at the bath/shower controls, one had to step into the tub as the hinge was distant from that end. There were no safety bars or handles to help extricate non athletes who ventured a bath. The water flow was restricted, and the temperature in early afternoon degenerated to warm at best. Towels were plentiful, toiletries of top quality, and two pristine white housecoats were available. Noise from the hallway and adjacent room was unexpected. Self parking is awkward at best in this city with a car hatred. However, valet parking worked flawlessly. The staff were uniformly excellent. The Yew bar and restaurant in the hotel were among the best I have experienced. Don't miss their 50% off any bottle of wine promotion on Sundays, available both for brunch and dinner. The hotel provides direct access to the major mall downtown, and is overall the best possible location. A stay at the Four Seasons is a costly adventure, but for the most part, we had good value. We were however quite disappointed by the fact that local calls were changed at $1.55 I'm sure the more expensive rooms here did not have most the flaws we experienced.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic service!”
Reviews.Author: Alvi_leite
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel was simple the best that I saw outside Asia. Everyone at the hotel is client oriented. I loved everything from the cleanliness of the rooms, to the gourgeous breakfast they served! The rooms are huge and king size beds are very confortable. Everything is done for you to feel just like at home! At the end of the day don't forget going for a run or swim at the fitness center! I stayed over for a week and things work always as in the first day! Impressive!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: Canadian007
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Outstanding staff service at all levels. Very comfortable bed - above other large chains. Overnight dry-cleaning service and complementary shoe shining in your room! Excellent restaurant, including in-room service. HD TV in your room, with wide selection of movies. Farily decent gym & pool faciity. Everything you expect for a best-in-class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Smooth as Silk”
Reviews.Author: adamunc
Reviews.Content: I'm a complete freak for hotel rooms and that's normally the most important thing to me when rating a hotel. So, I'm a little surprised to find myself giving 5 stars to a hotel that has nice, but not amazing, rooms. However, everything else here is so slick and perfect that I have to give it the top rating. Don't get me wrong, the rooms aren't bad or anything. They're not huge, but certainly not cramped either. The linens are all of high quality and the furniture is comfortable, especially the wonderful beds. The recent renovation has freshened up everything and the design scheme is restful, with beige background and either rust or sea-green accents. The big flat-screen worked well and had a good selection of channels. Bathroom is standard-issue; about the size of Marriott but dressed up with nicer toiletries and countertop. I don't understand why the glass door doesn't cover the full length of the tub, but it wasn't a problem. Views are pretty good once you get above the twelfth floor or so; lots of interesting city-scapes, plus if you're luck a mountain/water view. Location is great, central to everything--a twenty-minute walk would take you to just about anywhere in the downtown area you wanted to go, including Stanley Park. Other hotels nearby (in case you want to bar- or restaurant-hop) include the Fairmont Vancouver (great lobby lounge), the Met right across the street, and the Shangri-La, where MARKET by Jean-Georges has an amazing $32 prix-fixe lunch (try the braised short rib with apple and jalapeno). There's a skytrain stop in the mall attached to the 4S, but it can be confusing to find your way to it and back the first time. The hotel has both a lower-level street lobby and a second-floor lobby up an escalator which is where check-in and the restaurant are. These are done in a nice mix of both traditional and contemporary Asian decor. The restaurant, Yew, is phenomenal. It serves all three meals and has a lounge area, a large bar, and the restaurant proper. We found the service there to be sensational and sincere and the food was tops. It's a very interesting menu and everything we had was perfectly prepared. I can recommend the paella, the halibut, the buffalo meatballs in pasta with a great bleu cheese, and the appetizer of maple prawns (drool). Service in other areas of the hotel was also wonderful, from the all-over-it bell staff (never a wait for a taxi, never opened a door, bags taken and retrieved swiftly) to the attentive front desk. Those folks will take time in meeting any room preferences that they can, gladly change American to Canadian currency and even gave us customs forms when they realized we were headed back to the States. Another great feature of the hotel is fourth-floor pool/fitness center/garden. Good equipment, locker rooms including saunas, and a truly nice rooftop garden with waterfalls, streams, bridges, and plantings plus interesting views of downtown including the Top of Vancouver revolving restaurant where the food isn't so good but the views are. This was a terrific home base for our four days in Vancouver and everything was handled so smoothly that there was never any worry or stress.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort in the city of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: OrcasIslandDream
Reviews.Content: We traveled here for a long weekend with our 9 year old son and found the hotel convenient and comfortable. We reserved an executive suite which satisfied our needs, but as other reviewers have mentioned the bathroom is small and not what one expects at a five star hotel. We enjoyed the pool everyday of our stay and enjoyed the indoor/outdoor feature. It was fun to swim in the rain and then swim under the curtain and be in a warm indoor pool. We ate all our breakfasts in the hotel dining room and felt the service delightful and the food delicious. Our son ordered room service one night and it was hot and arrived when promised.

Reviews.Title: “1 of the best hotels i have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: pip8686
Reviews.Content: i book this hotel when i was visting friends in canada as we styed on vancover island we wanted to stay closer to the airport on are last night so was looking throw expidia and spoted this hotel and from past experance of coming to vancover i new it was in a good location it in placed right above the picific center mall and very naer robson street for shoping the concerge staff are very help full the aranged a privet car to take us to the air port from the hotel i would advis this as it is a fixed rate not like a cab and is atually the same price or lees so you might as well travel in styel next time we viset canada i think we will be staying there again such a memberal stay any questions please get in touch will be happy to help

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: lainey777
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay at the Four Seasons, Vancouver. First of all we were greeted by very friendly hotel staff who offered us a very nice upgrade to a suite with an excellent view. The Four Seasons was one of the nicer hotels in the downtown area that had a great location in the center of everything. I also enjoyed the complimentary fitness class that they provide. Tip: You can self-park in the parking lot at Pacific Place instead of through the hotel to save on the hotel taxes.

Reviews.Title: “poor value, very disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: scrapyardnow
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a last resort, but saw the Four Seasons name and thought I'd pay that bit extra for a couple of nights stay, was I disappointed. Had a very large room, with a nice city view on the 23rd floor, however the minibar was locked and there was no coffee maker, I'd just paid over 300 dollars a night and no coffee when i wake up!!!! Also the plumbing was bloody awful, I knew when my neighbours brushed their teeth, flushed the loo etc and the beds were back breaking, i have never had such a bad nights sleep, the beds are so soft it was like sleeping on a marshmallow. I was crippled in the morning! Also the car park was underneath the hotel, but you had to drive around the block to get into it after stopping outside reception, sorry but I'm not paying another 30 dollars for valet parking when i can do it myself, also if you get a room at the front expect a lot of building noise from the new condo thats been going up for the last couple of years, this hotel is facing the Metropolitan Hotel, dont bother with hotels either until the building work has been finished. Would I stay at this Hotel again, no way, check out the Le Soleil on hornby street its ten times better than this place.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel, But Not Great”
Reviews.Author: SurLeNil
Reviews.Content: I have stayed three times at the Four Seasons in Vancouver over the last couple of years. As a Four Seasons property, the rooms are comfortable and quiet. The lobby areas and YEW restaurant are also well maintained and very good. However, each time I stay, I always comment to myself that this was good and not great. I guess the disconnect I have is that the hotel and experience is similar to staying at a Westin however I am paying Four Seasons rates and have Four Seasons expectations. It is hard to put my finger on it but let me give an example. I have two deluxe rooms with my family that are connecting. Remember, these are deluxe and above their superior category but not a suite. The rooms are relatively basic and comfortable but nothing extraordinary from any four star hotel. The bathrooms are small in each room with a bathtub/shower combination as opposed to a separate shower stall. The counter in the bathroom is only big enough for one person at a time so my wife and I trade off getting ready in the morning. Again, everything is clean and works but is is average. Another example, today we got back at 3:40 in the afternoon after having left the hotel at 9:30 in the morning. Neither of our rooms were made up so I had to call housekeeping to get it done. They responded rapidly but is it too much to expect that this would not be necessary at a Four Seasons? Finally, when we travel with kids the nicer hotels normally send up a small treat such as cookies and milk. Other Four Seasons do this along with other top tier hotels. Not at the this Four Seasons. Do my kids need this? No. Would it be a nice touch? Yes it would. That is why I say that this Four Seasons is very good but not great. Within the range of Four Seasons properties, I would put this hotel towards the bottom and in the same league as a better Westin or Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are dated”
Reviews.Author: BHXTraveller55
Reviews.Content: The hotel did not meet the high standards you normally expect from a Four Seasons Hotel the rooms are dated and the hotel urgently needs a refurbishment. Service was mostly good, at braekfast one day I had to wait for ages, not good if you have to be at a business meeting on time. Food was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: phillyjd
Reviews.Content: I should have listened to the reviews on Trip Advisor and stayed at one of the higher ranked hotels. If you have stayed at other Four Seasons properties, this one will be disappointing. When I travel for leisure and can afford a splurge, I try to stay at a five-star place like the Four Seasons. You expect a certain amount of luxury. This property was not luxurious by Four Seasons standards. We arrived and had requested a quiet room near the end of a hallway and on a higher floor. We were assigned a room on the tope floor, but it was located directly across from the stairwell and the ice vending machine. It was not quiet in the least. When I asked for a different room, I was told that I could upgrade for $100 more/night. No way! The room was nice and the bed very comfortable, but it was just really nice. It was nothing special. We had stayed at a Marriott at the Brooklyn Bridge the weekend prior, and I would say it was nicer than our Four Seasons room. We were thankful to move on from the Four Seasons to our next stop in Seattle. At the Grand Hyatt there, we were provided an amazing room that far outstripped the Four Seasons in terms of luxury. And in terms of value, there was no comparison. The Four Seasons is in a great location, but on a future trip to Vancouver, I will stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families!”
Reviews.Author: TravelNut051
Reviews.Content: My husband had a business trip in Vancouver, so my son and I joined him. I was really impressed with the service they have for families and kids. They have a special "kids zone" that has play stations, WII, Fuze Ball, games, etc. They also had craft time every morning, and a cooking class with the chef of the restaurant there. My son had a great time! The Pool and hot tub was very kid friendly. They have a great outdoor patio too! As far as the rooms go, there are for sure nicer hotels out there. The bathroom was really small... We stayed at the Metropolitan right across the street last time, and they had a lot nicer rooms with huge marble bathrooms. The rooms at the Met were for sure a lot nicer. the four seasons did have a big flat screen TV and an IPOD docking station, and I am not sure if they Met had that. The service was really good at the four seasons, with very friendly staff. The only thing that is negative is the fact that I asked for a extra robe for our room and it never came. But other then that I was really impressed with the friendliness of the staff everywhere. The other negative is the fact that you had to pay for internet (plug in or Wi-Fi) where as at the Met. you had to pay for WI-FI, but not if you plugged your computer in to the outlet they have in the rooms. I really do not understand why expensive hotels do not offer free internet, that just seems silly. Over all - if we go back to Vancouver with our kids I will for sure stay there. If it was just my husband and I, I would probably stay at the Met, or somewhere else that has nicer rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: ivormom
Reviews.Content: Absolute perfection! I loved it, my kids loved it... great location, staff really cares, food is superb, very clean rooms! Quite happy with our stay and will return! The only negative is the temperature of the pool, can be chilly! If you are traveling from the airport the hotel is very close to the sky train and if you can manage your luggage the sky train is very good!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: suzyjacuzzi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for 5 nights in August. The hotel is centrally located which makes it easy to explore this beautiful city. This Four Seasons is a bit dated from some of the other Four Seasons we have stayed at, however, renovations were apparent. Our king room was huge with really high ceilings, crown molding, simple furnishings and a large/clean bathroom with high end bath products. Check in was a breeze and all of the staff we interacted with were extremely friendly and professional. The restaurant Yew is very modern and offers a unique menu. There is a large bar and table top area where customers can order off the appetizer menu or full menu. The bartender we encountered was very attentive and personable. The pool/spa/workout area is fantastic. There is a large indoor/outdoor pool with a nice hot tub. Surrounding the indoor pool area are the cardio machines and free weights. The layout definitely works and is very bright and airy with lots of windows looking out onto the rooftop terrace. The pool area also offers indoor and outdoor patio seating. There are lots of tables and chairs outside for relaxing, reading or lunch. Flavored waters and coffee are available in this area all day long. The gym equipment was state of the art and all cardio machines had cable television with complimentary headsets. Vancouver is a wonderful city to explore on foot. We were able to cover most of the major areas, including Granville Island, in 3 full days. Taxis are plentiful and accessible in case you would rather ride than walk. Stanley Park was definitely a highlight of our trip. We rented bikes on the boardwalk by the convention center and spent a few hours traveling the seawall and checking out some of the sights inside the park. Favorite restaurants on our trip included: Joe Fortes Seafood & Chop House, Cioppini’s and Coast. Local seafood and oysters are everywhere so you’re in luck if you are a seafood lover.

Reviews.Title: “best sleep ever”
Reviews.Author: W.O.F.
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Four Seasons for our wedding anniversary. Location was good, as well as service and spa/fitness rooms. The best part was the bed...like sleeping on a cloud! Unfortunately, the weather was not great, but with the help of the concierge, we were able to still do lots of outdoor activity, including riding bikes around Stanley Park and hiking at Lynn Canyon. I am proud to say that we did NOT use a car during our week in Vancouver, but used the Canada Line train, public buses and Seabus.

Reviews.Title: “loved the Vancouver Four Seasons with children!”
Reviews.Author: bernbe
Reviews.Content: great great staff and concierge service was amazing as well on the spot as in follow up. kids under twelve had breakfast lunch and dinner for free at the yew (hotel) restaurant. food at the restaurant was good but not star quality. breakfast was excellent with fresh fruit, cereals excellent bread. espresso had to be paid separately on top of buffet at 31cad. room, suite was a full one bedroom apartment with extra bed sofa. beds and bedlinen were perfect to! negative was the pool (chlorine in pool turned hair green even after intensive washing), poolside was understaffed; in the afternoon one could find all that was left by earlier customers. and the pool has (alike the outside of the building) very aged look, definitely needs an upgrade

Reviews.Title: “A classic, always the best”
Reviews.Author: sherlock1954
Reviews.Content: A quick trip to a conference at the convention center, this was not one of the listed hotels but we are glad we chose it. The luxurious bedding was worth it, we slept like lambs. For only 20 $ more than the conference hotels (Around 300$ with taxes) we had a beautiful city view room, all the best amenities (Occitane) and especially friendly service. We had dinner at the Yew Restaurant and enjoyed extremely high end cuisine, it was a lot of fun to see all the amazing dishes come out of the cuisine. A tip: we took the canada line train from the airport and got off at Vancouver city center, this saved us from traffic and taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and service!”
Reviews.Author: dhb9876
Reviews.Content: I came to Vancouver for a conference. This hotel is in a great location and within walkable distance to shopping, restaurants and the sea wall. My trip did not start off so well -- airline lost baggage and food poisoning (not from hotel). The concierge checked on my baggage so I wouldn't have to and then brought it my room. They gave me toiletries before I even asked for them. Late that night, I got very sick and had to make a call to the doctor on-call. Felt 100% the next day and the concierge continued to call me to be sure I was feeling well. Their service is top notch. Slept like a baby -- their beds are very comfortable! I did not stay with family, but was traveling with a co-worker, but would definitely come back with my family.

Reviews.Title: “This should not be a Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: Alex1234traveler
Reviews.Content: First off, I love the Four Seasons and have stayed at over 20 world wide properties. Unfortunately this has to be one of the worst. Thankfully the Four Seasons service and staff are top notch but the building and facility is in dire need of an update. The 12th floor reeks of old curry (seriously!!!) and the water in the tub smelled like Turpentine. the decor is really dated and the rooms are average. Pool and gym area is all old. If you like old and smelly, then this is your spot. if you want new and modern decor, you will need to look elsewhere. Yew restaurant was a disappointment as our server took over 15 minutes to serve us. A regular had come in and they decided to spend over 10 minutes catching up. If you are a Four Seasons regular, then you will be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: spudieDublin
Reviews.Content: stayed at the hotel for 3 days in late June. Room was fine for a 4* hotel. Very good location in downtown area with easy access to sights. Very close to train station that takes you from airport in about 20 mins. Would recommend it for stay in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Service, service, service...”
Reviews.Author: familyguy222
Reviews.Content: My family and I had the pleasure of staying at this hotel the night of 19 June, and then had Father’s Day brunch in the hotel restaurant on the 20th. This was one the best hotel experiences we’ve ever had. From start to finish our stay was excellent. Despite arriving on the heels of a large group we did not have to wait long before being welcomed by Andrea W. at the front desk. She was extremely friendly and helpful and we wish we could have thanked her again before we left. When we got to our room we were pleased once more as it was bright, spacious and comfortable. When I called down to the concierge desk that evening for dining advice Connie was cheerful and accommodating, and was even able to make a reservation for us at a local restaurant that doesn’t normally accept reservations. When we arrived at that restaurant the hostess sat us right away, despite there being a wait list, and remarked “isn’t it great to have connections like that?” When we got back to our room after dinner we found our daughter’s fold-out bed nicely made up and the extra toiletries and towels that my wife had requested waiting for us. On the Sunday we were meeting very old friends who we hadn’t seen in a long time who were driving up from Seattle to meet us for brunch. The front desk staff at “Yew” (the horel restaurant) were friendly and gracious when we explained that our friends had been delayed. Then, when they arrived, the nine of us were promptly seated in the “wine room”. All I can say is “wow”. That was a great spot: comfortable, bright, elegant, and it really eased our task of maintaining control over four children ranging in age from seven months to 11 years. The serving staff then continued the now familiar trend of efficient and courteous service. Thanks to all the staff at Yew, we had an excellent dining experience and a great visit with special friends. One generally assumes a high standard of service when staying at a Four Seasons Hotel. Even so, the staff and facilities continuously exceeded our already high expectations and contributed greatly to the overall success of our Father’s Day weekend. I just regret that we didn't have time to enjoy the excellent (by hotel standards) fitness centre or the beautiful infoor/outdoor pool and deck.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...very convenient”
Reviews.Author: caiqing
Reviews.Content: We got upgraded to a suite. The bath room is a little small but more than good enough. Very friendly service people and helpful. Got our taxi ready for us before we arrived at the lobby. Nice steak at the restaurant. Was the only dinner option during the Christmas Season, but we were glad we went for it. And shopping is very convenient. Right next to Pacific Centre, and the banks - if you have business to do. Walking distance to the port and seaside walk too :)

Reviews.Title: “LOVE, LOVE, LOVE the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: dkm101
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here now twice over the past year. Enjoyed it both times. Service was amazing. Everything taken care of, excellent turn down service in the evening. Loved eating a YEW in the hotel. Amazing food. Would come back again and again. Pool area is so cute. Location is awesome. A block from Robson, close to Canada Place. Can walk anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “made a rushed trip somehow enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: coachKC
Reviews.Content: due to family illness i had to cut short the length of my trip and travel across the country for just one day. i arrived at 9 am and hoped i might check my bag before the meetings. i was welcomed with my room and opportunity to take a swim before a days meetings. The health club, pool and the staff could not have been better. Our meeting rooms, dinner accomodations and service were equally 5-star. The best part for me though was at 4am(I am still on east coast time) I am out in the lobby ready to explore and the overnight doorman stopped what he was doing and gave me four options for an early cup of coffee. Obviously everyone in this hotels employ has been trained on the value of personal attention. I hope I will be able to extend my stay next time.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: florida7Edinburgh
Reviews.Content: we had a wonderful stay in this lovely hotel in a graet location.rooms great,nice pool and gym and extremely helpful staff.a great end to a wonderful location whiich started so badly in the worst b and b in the world.11TH STREET LODGING CALGARY.AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: ninjaqueen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived at the Four Seasons after a much-delayed flight, very frazzled and tired. We were met with attentive and friendly service from the doorman to the front desk to the bellman, who delivered our luggage quickly to our suite on the 8th floor. He also explained how to turn on the lamps, as it seems each one is different, but the lighting was excellent. The suite was perfect and also had some of my favorite amenities (L'Occitane in Provence). There was a full size hair dryer and the bathroom was very spacious. Our sitting room was lovely and the bedroom quite beautiful. We had a view of the "front" of the hotel. There was an ironing board and iron in the closet. A housekeeping maid met us shortly after our arrival to make sure that everything was in order. As we were wanting a small meal before we went to bed, we opted for the lounge/bar area (very popular) and didn't have to wait a moment to be seated. This is very cosmopolitan and sleek. We enjoyed appetizers of Peking duck wrapped in scallion pancakes and crab puffs along with wine. It was about $40, which is pricey, but it IS Vancouver and right downtown. The location of this hotel is excellent. It is within walking distance of so many shops as well as "The Bay" (Department Store). It is connected to a mall, which is very nice - I would imagine especially so in the winter months. We did not have any other meals at The Four Seasons, but found it to be extremely comfortable and everyone was very helpful. Our suite was perfect in every detail.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, great beds, great service”
Reviews.Author: granths
Reviews.Content: I love the Four Seasons. We were here in June and came with our dog. Here are the Pros and Cons: 1) When we arrived - they had a puppy bed, a bowl of dog cookies and bottled water in our room 2) The beds and bedding are very comfortable 3) Rooms are very clean 4) Hotel staff is very friendly 5) The front doormen are excellent 6) Great Concierge 7) The location is fantastic - it is attached to Pacific Center Shopping Center - which the skytrain goes to as well I actually don't have anything negative to say about this hotel! :)

Reviews.Title: “Where did the in room coffee maker go???? - Isn't this a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: InsearchofCoffee
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the 4 seasons for years. Always enjoyed my experience. And always appreciate that when you pay a premium price you get a premium service. Everything else is great , and yes there are lots of "Great" hotels in vancouver, all priced about the same (Have to thank the Olympics for them all). So I checked in late last night, woke up 6am local time expecting to make my coffee and can't find a in room coffee maker any where. Sure there's room service, but at nearly$240/night I wouldn't expect to have to wait and pay or leave my room for complimentary coffee in some other part of the hotel. Perhaps I'll try one of the other upscale hotels next time. I'll let you know how that works out. My rating is not perfect as I compare it against other hotels in it's class, although I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “not so nice”
Reviews.Author: travelwithpeople
Reviews.Content: we stayed in a deluxe room and was still quite small. the rooms were also quite old. compared to others four seasons hotels this wasn't so nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: devonmax123
Reviews.Content: stayed 3 nights, great front staff and concierge, located on top of Pacific Centre(shopping mall) which is attached to both City Centre and Granville skytrain stations. Front staff found out that it was our anniversary so manager send up great food/snack tray as compliment. Room is basic and clean, little small. Our room on 23rd flood facing constructions across the street but little view of waterfront. Complimentary newspaper, turndown service, has safe in room. Great comfortable king size bed, flat screen large tv...recommended this for location, across from Vancouver Art Fallery, next to Robson Street shops, 4 blocks easy walk to water front , many place to eat. There is also food court at Pacific Centre. Hotel provide variety of tea/coffee and light breakfast bakery at lobby in the morning (no coffee machine in room).We took Skytrain-Canada line from airport, which station is right across from Hotel.Very nice indoor-outdoor swimming pool together with workout gym.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Medicore Otherwise”
Reviews.Author: Jeunesse-Doree
Reviews.Content: Despite living a couple blocks away, I booked the 2 storey presidential suite for some mindless indulgence on my birthday. They recently renovated the suite so it looked nothing like the pictures on the website, it had no character, and resembled a generic business hotel room but larger. I wished they updated the photos or at least mentioned it to me prior to booking it. Despite the suite having a dining room and seating for 6 people, I was told I couldn't have 6 guests in my suite without having the hotel cater or provide room service, which I found odd but whatever, they wanted to make money. The room service staff were incredible and polite. The service at Yew was awful, I took my friend there for drinks and we waited 15 minutes to place our order and another 15 to get it, the female server was cold and unapologetic and blamed the bartender. While I'd give Yew a second try as the drinks were admittedly good, I wouldn't recommend staying here for a vacation/getaway and definitely not for a honeymoon, it's a total business hotel that lacks charm or style you'd normally get and expect with the Four Seasons franchise in other cities.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: BorenS
Reviews.Content: Any Four Seasons you go too is with class and luxury. If I have the choice to stay at any hotel it would be here. There service is great and the rooms are beautiful. You can't ask for anything more.

Reviews.Title: “Always a Pleasure to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Nina J
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Four Seasons several times for business and I return for leisure when I go into the city for weekend excursions. The rooms are always very clean, the beds are ridiculously comfortable, and the service phenomenal. The concierge is always extremely helpful. The pool/gym area is lovely and the changerooms feel sort of like a spa. I go just to sit in the hottub and drink one of the fruit-infused water selections they carry. Never been the restaurant Yew although I've been meaning to and it looks great. I love that it's attached to the mall and that I can take a five minute walk from my room to grab a latte to bring back. Great location in the heart of downtown. I've stayed in many hotels in downtown Vancouver but this is by far my favorite. My only complaints are that it's a tad pricey and the view from the rooms is usually quite ugly, but that's what you get staying right in the middle of downtown.

Reviews.Title: “They Hooked us up!!”
Reviews.Author: BigDaddy93
Reviews.Content: On the night of my wedding night I booked at the Four Seasons for the night. When I got there in my suit and the wife in hers we were immediately upgraded to a suite and given 2 free breakfasts worth $85 and not to mention free parking!!! Everything they did for us was greatly appreciated and I will be there again for sure....

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: travelingwithkeiko
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: Easy access to and from airport and other locations. Subway right across street. If not renting a car ( which i suggest not to bec. you can go anywhere with subway or bus easily) its just one train to front of hotel from airport. Connected to mall is great especially when it rains. Can access mall before opening hours and it helped us because our 3 yr old needed to run and be entertained. Food court in mall also a plus along with food court of The Bay. London Drugs (convenience store) right across street and can access by never going out if you use mall entrance. Robson street for shopping is one block away. HOTEL: Clean and what to expect from 4 seasons. But hotel rooms a bit smaller than expected. Everything worked and no complaints. POOL: Average size and heated. Half the pool is indoors and the other is outdoors. Which was nice because we went in December 2009 and our daughter loved going outside and looking at the steam. Overall pool, jacuzzi and gym is fair. Remember its not a resort and in the heart of the city. FOOD: We tried the YEW restaurant and it was nice. We thought it was better than leaving hotel. Kids 5 and under eat free and they cater to the kids very well (the quantity is easily for a 5 year old). We aren’t too picky with food so cant give a good comment on taste but we liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Where's the coffee machine?”
Reviews.Author: jiffypop101
Reviews.Content: Overall, a decent hotel but we had to call the front desk to ask for a coffee maker and were told it was in the lobby. We have travelled all over the world and find this a very odd thing for such a high class hotel. After I insisted they brought us a coffee maker after making us wait about an hour and having to call a second time. Get this!
