They bring you a refill bag only after you call again and charge you $10 for it. Not to mention that you have to wait for them to arrive with it. So, after 5 days I was charged $50 plus taxes for the right to have coffee each morning in my room. We will never stay here again and were made to feel like second rate citizens. On one evening out we stopped at a Tim Hortons and grabbed a cup to bring back to the room and I felt like I was breaking the rules sneaking up to my room with a cup of coffee! There are other nice 5-star hotels in Vancouver. Next time we will try one of those. The Restaurant on the property (YEW) was very nice but that's not enough to bring us back to this hotel. As I mentioned earlier, NEVER AGAIN will I allow a hotel to treat me and my husband like this. Shame on you four seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, Hip Hotel with excellent views and in the center of town”
Reviews.Author: DMVinSD
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my wife's birthday. Very trendy and modern feel to this four seasons - it goes well with the style of the city. We had a room (I forget what floor) with an unreal view of the bay and subsequent skyline. It is on top of a shopping plaza that is connected to the subway. Everything is within walking distance and as always, the Four Seasons experience and level of service did not disappoint. I would recommend the restaurant "Gotham", which is around the block. Fantastic wine selection, great steaks and the atmosphere was A+. This was a top recommendation from the concierge, which also set us up with a helicopter tour over to Vancouver Island. Great Hotel, great service and a wonderful city to visit. . . . at least in the summer!

Reviews.Title: “Lots to love”
Reviews.Author: seattlefamilyoffive
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with extended family after Christmas through New Year's. I'm sure there are fancier hotels in Vancouver but none that is more comfortable than this Four Seasons. We had two rooms for our family of five and they were connected by a little private entryway that allowed us to leave our doors open and move between rooms freely. Very nice. The bathrooms and rooms were extremely clean and adequately spacious. Nicely decorated with city views. The maid service was outstanding as was the room service which we ordered the night before for 5 am so we could go to Whistler for the day. The food was on time, hot and delicious. In the lobby there was an extremely helpful concierge that made restaurant recommendations and reservations as well as reservations for ski school in Whistler. Directions and maps provided for every trip and destination. Super nice. Also the hotel has a great area for kids off the lobby with video games and tables for coloring and board games. It's like a library in a castle, really big and beautiful. For adults and kids the gym/pool rooms are clean and well stocked with towels, headsets and a selection of fruit infused waters to refresh yourself with. It was December and we were able to swim in the indoor/outdoor pool with no problem. And the hot tub and sauana were really hot, the way they are supposed to be. The hotel is situated in the middle of downtown, surrounded by shops and restaurants, on top of a very nice mall and close to the art museum, We all had a great time at this hotel, there was something to love for everyone from the littlest kid, 7 yrs old to teenagers to grandparents.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Will be back”
Reviews.Author: Ridgesas
Reviews.Content: Was here for 3 nights on a business trip. The hotel is located in the heart of the Vancouver business district. The hotel itself is a little older although the rooms have been refurbished recently. Room amenities are top notch and the bed was very comfortable. Turndown service every evening was great. The lobby area and resteraunt are very nice and well designed. Very clean and comfortable. Service is typical Four Seasons, great attention to detail. Will definetely be back here.

Reviews.Title: “FOUR seasons”
Reviews.Author: TequilaB
Reviews.Content: stayed here for my birthday, Yew resturant is beatutiful and food is great i highly recommend reserving the glass room filled with 300 different bottles of wine and the raw bar is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: jetlaggad
Reviews.Content: FS Vancouver will start to face some serious competition after many years as " the " hotel in Vancouver. IMHO the hotel is somewhat dated and rooms are comfortable but gives an " old " impression . No sockets in convenient location for the work desk etc. Bath rooms are very dated , you would hope that a FS hotel has walk in showers , not having to fight a shower curtain in the bath tub , leaving massive puddles on the floor. For a business traveler it is annoying to note that the FS now welcomes hordes of pre / post cruise guests who really crowd up the lobby / bar / restaurant in an FS unlike manner. However , almost everything can be forgiven due to the excellent service and attitude from the staff in all departments of the hotel , they are simply outstanding and very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: Temescal
Reviews.Content: The good: - Awesome central location, right on top of a mall, makes for easy shopping and cheap food. It's also within walking distance from other commercial streets, such as Granville, and Robson Street. - Rooms we clean and roomy. Cleaning crew was awesome. - The bed was one of the best I've had in a hotel. - Indoor/outdoor swimming pool, with nice hot tub. There are but a few things better than taking a leisurely swim after a long day of shopping, while looking up to the the people stuck working late in office buildings. Service at the pool/gym was great. The not so good: - We had no less than TWO TVs in the room, but a TV guide was nowhere to be found, reception wasn't very good, and the picture was very grainy on most channels. Also, what's the point of two HDTVs if the none of the channels are in high-def? - The bathroom was tiny. - We had paid extra for a "view" room, and a good part of our view was the construction site across the street, loud and unsightly. I know that the construction site is not Four Season's fault, but I feel that, until the construction is done, they shouldn't be selling any of the rooms on that side as "view" rooms. I felt somewhat cheated. - When I told the reception, upon checking in, that it was our tenth anniversary, the person checking us in asked us what day, and told us he'd have room service bring us something special on that date. We thought it was a nice gesture, and weren't expecting more than a card, or a couple chocolates. I was actually dubious that we would actually receive anything. I was right. I wasn't expecting Four Seasons to get out of their way to help me celebrate our anniversary, but they volunteered for it, and did not follow up. I'd rather the receptionist hadn't said anything...

Reviews.Title: “excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: jackocalgary_AB
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our small dogs. It's clearly the staff that make this hotel what it is!! They couldn't do enough for us. The rooms are nice & the location is great. We didn't move our vehicle in the three nights we stayed. It's a ten minute walk to waterfront. The rates are very low at this time (the economy??) Would highly recommend for anyone wanting to be in the centre of the city

Reviews.Title: “thumbs up!!”
Reviews.Author: LovinTheGoodStuff
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 2407 with views of the city well lots of construction (in the lead up to 2010 winter Olympics) and a view of the local HSBC office building. On the plus side as it’s on the 24th floor: quiet from the street level noise and has a partial mountain view. Our room size was adequate, nicely decorated. It also had a Big flat screen TV (LG) with a decent amount of channels (cira-60) also had a very comfy single seat with matching stall and a work desk with lamp (if necessary). Room lighting consists of 4 lamps and No main light. A superior radio clock (with iPod dock) was a nice feature. Room had ample storage space: good wardrobe space (with a sufficient amount of hangers) and 4 draws in the TV stand - which I find is very understated and rarely provided by hotels. Bed was amazingly comfortable (very strong contender for my favourite hotel bed ever). Bathroom is nicely done- simple and effective, but quite small (by North American standards). Has a shower/bath combo. The shower had adequate water flow although not luxurious (if I was being pedantic). I really wasn’t a big fan of the shower guard as it ruins the bath and shower layout and seems quite dated. Room had essentials – bathrobes, tissues, soap, shower-gel, shampoo, ear buds, hair dryer etc etc. I liked the shampoo and shower gel but the soap not so much. Has turn down service (more revenue generating than comfort orientated). Free daily newspaper delivered to room (must use door knob labels) and free internet access in the lobby. Nice gym facilities, swimming pool is not heated and partially outside - I found this quite enjoyable (my partner not so much). Check in and out was speedy and effective and all with a friendly smile. We've been to Vancouver before so knew we wanted downtown (access to everything) but in a decent central location. Hotel joins a shopping centre/mall which has everything you could want from a shopping experience (food, clothing etc) and all accessible without venturing outside (if the weather is bad). Helpful Tip Canada line skytrain takes you straight to the hotel (via the shopping mall) from Vancouver “VYR” airport (cira $2.50 to $3.75 depending on arrival day/time) and takes about 20mins door to door. With minimal fuss and great after a long flight.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a Fabulous city.”
Reviews.Author: uncle_albert5
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons, Vancouver is a great hotel. The location puts you in the heart of downtown with food, shopping and nightlife right outside the door. There is literally an undergound shopping mall attached to the hotel! The stafff are all very courteous and helpful. I was there for a business meeting and had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Too posh for a coffee maker/kettle!”
Reviews.Author: Moy62
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Four Seasons for 2 nights prior to our cruise, the room was lovely, clean and spacious, we do however like to make a drink and were informed that there was always coffee available in the lobby, which in our case was several floors down, this is only a minor point but we would have preferred some way of making a herbal tea than a fridge full of snacks and drinks that were extremely expensive. The hotel was chosen for us by our cruise company but we would not choose to go ther again ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great experience”
Reviews.Author: Claire_ds
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel in the heart of downtown Vancouver. The shopping malls are just below. Conveniently located close to everything. Very clean rooms and friendly staff. The concierges were very helpfull. Enjoyed dining at Salam Bombay just 2 blocks away. The Room service order taker messed up with our break fast orders other than that it was a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Great time in a great city”
Reviews.Author: travelkd
Reviews.Content: We spent a week's time in the spacious family suite at the Four Seasons before taking off onto an Alaska cruise. The hotel is very conveniently located downtown Vancouver, within walking distance to shopping areas, Gastown and Canada Place. Staff was most helpful whenever asked. Great breakfast at the Yew restaurant. The city itself has a fantastic scenery, is very clean and young at heart. We'd definitely return again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Quite sadly a genric hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beckett
Reviews.Content: The first question that came to mind was "How is this a Fours Seasons hotel?" If not for the FS bed and bathrobes, I would not have believed that I was in a FS hotel. The room was small, and the bathroom was a flash back to the 80's. I think it is an absolute disgrace to the Four Seasons brand that this hotel be allowed to exist without a major overhaul of all its rooms. Everything from the lobby, rooms, to the service (almost nil) reeked of generic banality. Don't get me wrong; there's nothing actually wrong with anything. But for goodness sakes, this isn't a Hilton or a Holiday Inn. Given the hotel's prime location in the downtown Vancouver, it could have been a premier hotel with superior service. One good thing is the hotel restaurant Yum whose decor felt like night and day compared to the hotel lobby which was only a few steps away. Not only is the decor quite modern, but food and service were superb. It was the sole bright point of our stay there. The building itself may be old, but to leave it old and slap a FS name on it is a great disservice. We will stay at another place next time we're in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great restaurant for Tapas”
Reviews.Author: LadySamurai
Reviews.Content: I took my mom here for a shopping trip. The shopping at Holt Refrew was awful(what has happened to them?) but our stay at the hotel was lovely. The service was impeccable. We really enjoyed eating healthy Tapas at the restaurant and the service was very friendly. The rooms are not awe-inspiring especially compared to the Seattle Four Seasons. They are comfortable and quiet but not worth the price. I would stay here again if Vancouver had better shopping for anyone over a size 6.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tan611
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay prior to leaving for an Alaskan cruise. Very nice hotel, upgraded to an premium executive suite for 520 but watch out for the taxes in vancouver! They are a real surprise at the end. Nice touches included personalized cookies with milk for the kids at check in, even though we didn't get in til midnight. They loved it. Location, gym, pool all were very good as was the service. wish at these rates at least they could throw in free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: conradbaines
Reviews.Content: Overall this was a great hotel. We were there from June 9-11, 2008 and there was a nice pool (indoor and outdoor). The restaurant downstairs had good food. The hotel is connected to a mall. This hotel was great and I will stay there when I go back.

Reviews.Title: “Golden nights”
Reviews.Author: fisico70
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in Vancouver at Four Seasons. The hotel is located in the downtown just above one of the best shopping centre. The breakfast is very good with a great variety of fruit and cakes, which also suits the European tastes. The room is very nice, with a fabulous bed, so comfortable that you would like to bring it home. The staff is friendly and the hotel is very clean. A complain is about the swimming pool, which is half indoor and half outdoor. Some days the weather was too cold for our taste, so not so nice to have a swim. Also the Wi-fi connection is too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more from a Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: radiationmd
Reviews.Content: When you hear the name Four Seasons, you expect the ultimate luxury and service. But, I just did not get that at the Four seasons Vancouver. Everything was ok but not spectacular. Negatives: 1-They charged us $7.50 for a bottle of water! 2- No complimentary coffee in the room 3- No wireless internet in the room 4- Very small business center with only two computers, always had to wait and only get 15 monutes at a time. 5- only one restaurant (yew) in the entire hotel, although it is a nice one 6- No airport shuttle 7- Very limited choice of TV stations. No ESPN, TNT, CNBC, etc Positives -location -the most comfortable mattresses I have slept on! -complimentary shoe-shine sevice -Decent fitness facility Overall, if you get a rate under $200, it is not such a bad deal given the location. On the other hand, if you are looking for a majorly plush hotel, you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Lost opportunity”
Reviews.Author: twoginsonetonic
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Four Seasons Vancouver a few years ago and been extremely disappointed by the quality of the rooms and general level of decor, we were looking forward to returning to the newly refurbished hotel. Service remains excellent and fully up to Four Seasons global standard. The new Yew restaurant is light years ahead of the old one in every respect and we very much enjoyed breakfast and dinner there. Our Premier Executive Suite had been recently made-over but remains way below the level expected of a Four Seasons. New wallpaper and carpets cannot compensate for the outdated structure of the rooms: the ceilings feel amongst the lowest of any luxury hotel in which I have stayed, the en-suite bathroom attached to the suite's bedroom is microscopic, the bedroom itself is cramped compared with the size of the living room and noise-proofing sounds non-existent. Failure to significantly reconfigure the accomodations renders the the current refurbishment programme a lost opportunity to reposition property amongst the top tier of the Four Seasons group.

Reviews.Title: “Love It!!!”
Reviews.Author: LondonLondon095
Reviews.Content: We went to vancouver in december and could not make it up to whistler because of the snow storm, the first hotel we thought of to spend christmas eve and christmas day was the four seasons! I love this hotel, the service is outstanding the food great and fantastic location! We have stayed here many times and I must say that the first time we stayed about 5 years ago the rooms were a bit shabby but, the service was still fantastic! Now the hotel has had an overhall and the rooms are really lovely! I visit vancouver twice a year and would not even thick about staying anywhere else!1 ofcourse if you have been to any four seasons you will know how great they are with children, gifts milk and cookies and great kids menu!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: apawley
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in April with my wife and two children (12 & 9). We had interconnecting rooms. The hotel lobby was being refurbished so we had a great rate. The hotel is in a great location and the restaurant for breakfast was excellent. Rooms were very big and well decorated. Nice touch of welcome cookie with milk with each child's name on it upon arrival. We had a lovely stay and are looking forward to returning this year.

Reviews.Title: “Winter at the Four Seasons Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: PilotLondon
Reviews.Content: Outstanding service, excellent restaurant with 'tastings' program, whereby any bottle of wine may be opened and sold in quarters of the bottle price, rather than lesser wine by the glass. In this way, some stupendous world wines may be sampled without being gouged, or the necessity to purchase the entire bottle (although after the flavours of my first quarter struck me, I certainly did). Food, service, ambience, location, view, amenities and room comfort, this hotel is certainly the best I've ever stayed at in North America.

Reviews.Title: “Faux Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: MrSantaBarbara_8
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with a 3rd night free promotion which came to about 150US per night ,at this rate it is a bargain. If you are expecting a luxurious room you're at the wrong hotel, the rooms are more like a Hilton as far as the amenities go. The restaurant was very good and looked like it had been remodeled, the food was pricey but very good as was the service. The bathrooms are tiny, I stayed on the top floor and when I raised my hand to put deodorant on my hand hot the ceiling in the bathroom and I am only 5"11". If you're pay Four Seasons prices you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: VancouverRani
Reviews.Content: Horrible service and horrible experience. Would advise everyone to stay away from this place. They have no idea how to treat clientele. The booking agent was horrible and the manager far worse. You can get much better value for your money. They do not understand what service means.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but old school”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior4
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights while in town on business. Location is good, right downtown and connected to the Pacific Centre Mall. As other reviews will confirm the rooms are dated but clean and well maintained, and the service is excellent. While I was upgraded to a suite at no charge, the bottom line is that I never felt comfortable. Since then I've been to Vancouver twice and chose to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, rooms a little dated”
Reviews.Author: seblong
Reviews.Content: Multiple stays at the Four Seasons for business and one romantic weekend getaway. Great location. Hotel is a little bit dated, however, best service I have ever had at a hotel. Great gym and pool. My only other reference in Vancouver is the Metropolitan (opposite the Four Seasons), so where possible I will compare the two. Rooms: Little bit dated, however, all the rooms I've had have been large and spacious. Decent desk to work from and easy chair. Bathrooms have bath/shower combo. Not as nice as the Metropolitan's bathroom, but not too bad. I've always had a great view of the city from my room. Service: By far the stand out feature of the hotel. What impressed me when I first arrived was that when I got to the check in desk, the receptionist seemed to know my name. It took me a while to work it out, however, when I arrived by taxi, the bell boy looked at the luggage tag on my bag and called reception as I was on my way to them. The Four Seasons has a staff policy to make sure that they always greet you with your name at any contact. Sounds silly, but it works to be appreciated. Great concierge. Nothing ever seems too much trouble (e.g. coming in at 2-3am and getting your shoes picked up for shoe shining before your meeting in the morning). Food: Had a couple of meals at the hotel. Restaurant was usually very quiet, although food was of good quality. Breakfast buffet is very expensive, although worth it (if your employer is paying!). Lobby bar has a nice vibe. Facilities: The gym is the best I've ever seen in a hotel. The pool is half indoors, and half outdoors. When you're working out, the staff will bring you fruit flavoured water. Again, service excellence. Location: Great. Right next to my offices, and all the best bars, shops and restaurants within a short walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service...”
Reviews.Author: hanspa
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Four Seasons hotel. The room was very large with two double beds, a full sitting area and a desk. The bathroom was very large and fully stocked with amenities including the great white bathrobes. Service was superior; whether it was room service or the front desk everyone was very helpful and willing to add the additional 'wow'. Gym amenities were adequate with a wonderful outdoor/indoor pool. Change rooms also include sauna and lockers. Free coffee and water are available in the sitting area. Gym is very large open concept with a view to the outdoors. Great place to read your morning paper after a run. Location is excellent - connected to Pacific Mall right in the heart of downtown Vancouver all sites are close including Gas Town, Stanley Park and Yaletown.

Reviews.Title: “Needs work.”
Reviews.Author: Altasaurus
Reviews.Content: Vancouver is a fabulous destination. It has world class parks, attractive beaches and yacht harbors, urban amenities, outstanding restaurants and great people. What it lacks is a Four Seasons hotel. This property just does not make it when compared with other FS city hotels and resorts. As mentioned in several other posts, the big problem is the building itself. It is dated in both design and operations. At night we could hear elevators, heating and plumbing. A year or so ago we stayed at the Four Seasons Los Angeles at Beverly Hills. It’s in an urban setting, but the moment you step inside you immediately feel that it’s a welcoming retreat from the city outside. Not so at the Vancouver property. Part of the problem is awkward architecture, as the entry level (for taxis or when you’re walking) is a barely welcoming reception area. You need to take an escalator to the main lobby, which might not be a problem except that the main lobby is also cold, and on the night of our recent arrival, extremely noisy, as it is adjacent to, and almost part of the Yew restaurant and bar. This a structural problem, but not related to the age of the building. Yew has just been substantially renovated, and in fact it's a great restaurant and bar. It’s just not properly separated from the lobby, which should have been done at the time of the renos. The reception clerks have to speak quite loudly to make themselves heard over the din. There were also a couple of minor service issues. The hotel was obviously not at capacity, and the reception clerk offered an upgrade, but stipulated a price of an extra $100 per night. I turned it down. I should have been more direct and demanded a free upgrade but I was pretty surprised that there was a proposed charge, and didn’t feel like haggling (in necessarily raised voices) in the lobby. Over the years we have stayed at FS properties elsewhere, including Los Angeles, Hualalai and Lanai. This weekend was our 17th and 18th nights with Four Seasons in the past 12 months. We have received upgrades in the past, without ever being requested to pay more. The way I see it, if you have an empty suite and a good customer, why wouldn’t you offer a free upgrade? Apparently that’s not the way the FS Vancouver looks at it. Another, also minor, service issue was that I phoned the concierge to get a local radio station frequency. She didn’t know and said she would phone back. She didn’t. When I called 10 minutes later, she had the information, but said she had forgotten my room number. The room itself, a “deluxe” king, was not of FS quality. Closet, bathroom and dresser were small. The desk features a spaghetti-like tangle of electrical cords underneath, in full view (admittedly a bit like my office, but I don’t rent my office out by the night). Non-flat screen tv. I was also appalled at the windows which can be opened at floor level. This is a high rise building, and there is no balcony, so this window would lead to a multi-storey drop. I haven’t seen those in hotels in 20+ years, and would urge anyone with small children not to book one of these rooms. Those windows are a tragedy waiting to happen. As mentioned, Yew restaurant and bar was excellent. Our guests were Vancouver residents, but had not yet tried the FS’s new restaurant and were very impressed. Food, drink and service were excellent. It’s an expensive night out, but you definitely get what you pay for. I will also add that the Vancouver FS is in an excellent location, which is one reason I have gone back several times since the 80's. But it’s in a very competitive market and there are excellent hotels close by, for example the Fairmont Hotel Vancouver and the very nicely renovated Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Five star staff trapped in a four star building!”
Reviews.Author: JP3CHICAGO
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many FS properties across the world and truly appreciate the brand. I knew from other reviews that this would not be a five star location. Let me state that the property was clean, everything was in working order, and it was well located. The reason that I booked this hotel is that I hoped that the staff would make up for any shortcomings of the facility. Upon arrivial I knew that I was right. I do not know where they find such great people. The staff was able to make us overlook the "1970's Marriott style building" and made our stay feel pretty close to a five star Four Seasons experience. The front desk, concigere, bar, and valet staff were all wonderfu! It is not thier fault the building is showing it's age although they seem to work a little harder to maintain the high standards and make sure that we had a great experience. Look at some negative reviews on Trip Advisor. It is typically the hotel employees who ruin an experience for a guest. Most low reviews are from travelers who expected something that was not delivered by the hotel staff. That said, this location actulally improves my opinion of the FS brand. If the price is correct I will tolerate mediocre (but clean) decor as long as it is met with caring, talented , and hosptiable individuals who excel at thier jobs. Someday soon I am sure that the company will make the investment and upgrade the rest of the building. (They just finished the bar and dining room) At that point it will be back among the best that Vancouver has to offer. Until then enjoy the reasonable rates, great service, and convienent location in a great weekend city. Here are a few insider tips! Find out when B.C. days are and book that weekend. We happened to be there on this three day weekend in August 08 and had a blast. There were concerts, fireworks, and activities everywhere! Book the Premier room for a great view and a little extra space! It is worth a few extra dollars. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Solid if Unspectacular Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: Counterweight
Reviews.Content: The Vancouver Four Seasons is a very nice property, but not as nice as many of the other properties in the Four Seasons property. The location is good. It's close to the convention center, the art museum and a mall (as well as the Robson Street entertainment and shopping district). It can be awkward to drive to, given the number of one-way roads close to it, but that is to be expected in a major city. Depending on the time of day, it's also pretty easy to get down to Granville Island, to Stanley Park and across the river to North Vancouver. The rooms are good-sized although many of them don't have much of a view (the hotel is surrounded by several other high rise buildings). The pool/terrace on the 4th floor is great, and has a nice view of the Harbour Center Tower. I did not eat at the restaurant ("Yew") though I've heard it's good. I did spend some time at the bar which was inviting and cozy (if also a bit loud). I didn't experience anything bad at the Vancouver Four Seasons, but I also didn't get that "wow" factor that I expect at top-end hotel in a major city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: foreverandme
Reviews.Content: This was a couple of years ago, but I thought that I could include it. My dad was able to book this hotel through some air miles points, so we got it free. We stayed there for two nights. I was very pleased by the service. The children got a glass of milk, a giant m &m cookie with their names printed at the top with icing, and a drink container each. The service was great and all, and as an extra bonus, the hotel was connected to a mall! The one minor problem that I had with this trip, was one of the staff at the recreation centre. The pool was very nice - half of it was indoors and the other half was outdoors, and there was a gym next to it. The outdoor half was in this oasis garden, with flowers and mini cascading waterfalls. One of the staff that was in charge of looking after that area was incredibly rude. While our kids were in the pool (they were quite big - they were in Gr. 4, Gr. 12, and Gr. 8), he kept watching them, although we were keeping an eye out at them. In addition to that, he told my mother to get off the treadmill for no apparent reason - it wasn't spoiled or anything like that. Other then that, this hotel was extremely relaxing and I would totally go back there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: newyorklover123
Reviews.Content: Great place! Loved both restaurants, the pool and the suite was lovely, adajcent to the Pacific mall which has great shopping, lovely four seasons staff! Great place!

Reviews.Title: “Quality location”
Reviews.Author: The_UK
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week there and was totally satisfied with what we got. All the staff are very friendly and helpful. I cant really think of a bad point except maybe the lack of tea making facility in the room but having said that if you go to the lobby floor before 8am there is free coffee/tea ready. The location is perfect for exploring the city, our other hotel choice was the pan pacific but after walking down there to get to the sea front we were glad we chose not to stay there as the walk was pretty long. The four seasons is located 1 block from the busy street of Robson where there are loads of shops/restaurants. The hotel also has a shopping mall underneath it.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Service & Working on the Rest”
Reviews.Author: travelwithkids_7
Reviews.Content: After reading so many mixed reviews, we were somewhat skeptical heading in, so bar wasn't set as high as at other Four Seasons we've stayed at. But we always are impressed w/ the great service and this was no disappointment. The hotel staff were great, the concierges very knowledgable and gave us excellent suggestions. One real differentiator is their patience in changing reservations since travelling w/ kids requires flexibility. The rooftop pool was a real hit w/ the kids and having the gym right there at the pool enabled us to work out while they swam. The rooms were a decent size, but the bathrooms were not up to Four Seasons or 5 star quality. I agree w/ many of the other posters, that the physical attributes of the hotel are dated and unspectacular, but we learned that the entrance and lobby have been renovated, and there are other updates coming, so hope this will once again be a tier one hotel. Lastly, we ate dinner at the lobby restaurant "Yew" and found the staff, food quality and selection and ambiance very good. Would definitely give a go. We also had dinner at a local restaurant Salam Bombay (Indian food) that was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service.”
Reviews.Author: sundans
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exceptional. The staff is beyond compare. Rooms were VERY comfortable, clean and quiet. Nice roof-top pool area and fitness center. GREAT bar. I would highly recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons for a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: ElenaAP
Reviews.Content: It's the Four Seasons. Naturally (and rightfully) you expect top-of-the-line, nothing-but-the-best. So when we arrived, I was bubbling with anticipation (this was my first stay at a Four Seasons). The lobby wasn't mind-blowing, but the front desk service was exceptional. I overlooked the average-looking lobby, assuming the rooms would be a wonder. You can probably guess why I am building this up so much -- they were incredibly underwhelming. I'm not one to pick -- when not on a business expense tab, I am rather frugal -- so when I get to stay at such prestigious establishments, it really is a treat for me. But not this time. The room was quite small. The furniture, drapery and carpet were very dated, and the amenities less than what I would have expected. What a disappointment. The best part of the room was the bathroom -- it wasn't big, but it was really nice. And there were L'Occitane products, which always makes me happy. At best, I would call this experience average, and that is only because the room service, concierge, valet and front desk service were absolutely phenomenal. Unless you're getting a ridiculously good rate (like a corporate rate of $170 / night), take your $$$ and spend it at a better establishment. Or go to a lower priced establishment and buy the L'Occitane products with your savings!!

Reviews.Title: “Hot Food”
Reviews.Author: second row
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have pointed out this hotel lacks the "wow" factor of other FS properties .I would never be surprised to see the chain building afresh in this stunning city as the rooms are dated and remodel costs could be high. It is too close to FS home to alow this to continue for too long.(yes I know Vancouver is a long way from Toronto but you know what I mean!) Service, furnishings, pool all top draw but be sure to visit the "Yew restaurant" even if you are not resident.This recently opened dinery with its open kitchen is turning out really very good food and well above standard hotel fare.It appears that the locals have caught on and its now "hot" on the local scene. They worked hard to get us seated at a busy time.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with room”
Reviews.Author: ursula13
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at the Four Season in Vancouver because I have always loved the Four Seasons chain of hotels and have stayed at various locations worldwide. The actual hotel was ideally situated in downtown Vancouver near the Conference Center. The lobby, restaurant and service of staff was impeccable. However, the room left much to be desired. The layout of the room was awkward, with the dresser by the door entrance and nowhere near the beds. The TV was out of date with a remote that was extremely dusty. You could not sit on the couch and watch TV. The curtains and the furniture were absolutely atrocious. The telephone was broken. There were popcorn ceilings. Honestly, I could not believe I was in a Four Seasons, which typically have modern rooms. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, unless they update and modernize the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful & comfortable rooms, but avoid the overpriced food!”
Reviews.Author: 1AvidTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night before our Princess Alaska Cruise Tour. The price was exorbitant but well worth it, as this hotel had, very possibly, the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept in. All of the front desk/concierge/bellstaff were friendly and helpful, and the hotel location was ideal as it was an easy walk to the Gastown area as well as being part of the Pacific Centre mall. One thing I will say is that even for a Four Seasons, the food--especially the room service and the dinner at the main restaurant--was ridiculously overpriced. We stayed at a Renaissance Marriott in Seattle at the end of our trip and the room service prices were literally half that of the prices at this hotel. All in all though, due to the comfort of the room, the location of the hotel, and the staff, our stay at the Four Seasons Vancouver was a great one.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Four Seasons Vancouver!!!”
Reviews.Author: arizonat
Reviews.Content: We loved our 8 day stay at the Four Seasons Vancouver. Their service was impeccable, from the front desk to the concierge to the bellman. We visited with our 1 year old daughter, and they treated her like a princess. They equipped our room with baby soap, shampoo, lotion, baby powder, a diaper pail, outlet covers, a highchair with a padded mat beneath it, and a beautiful brass crib with yellow gingham linens of top quality. When we entered our room, we were greeted with a cookie they had baked with pink and purple M&Ms in it and her name written across it in frosting, along with a sippy cup of milk on ice. I have never experienced service as attentive as this! The location is excellent. It is close to public transportation and the concierges are extremely helpful. They gave us coupons for the Stanley Park Aquarium, made change for the buses, and recommended some top notch restaurants. We really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is very upscale and sophisticated, but they really went out of their way to make our baby feel welcome. We probably won't be staying at such upscale hotels like this once she is a little older, because the noisiness of typical toddlers/kids wouldn't really be appropriate for this place, but since she is a quiet/well-behaved baby, it really worked out for us this time.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for what we got”
Reviews.Author: SarniaJD
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for one night in April 2008. The hotel is in a good location, but I felt it was way overpriced for what we got. Staff were friendly enough and the room was clean, but we could have stayed in most other area hotels (with a clean room and friendly staff) for 2-3 nights for what we paid here. Having travelled extensively for business in the last few years, I have come to realize that the service in most moderate hotels (ie. Holiday Inn) has improved greatly in recent years and the "upscale" hotels charging very high prices will need to reconsider what they are offering for $300+ per night in order to remain competitive.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: katie569
Reviews.Content: When I was a kid, the old man would treat us 5 kids to brunch at the four seasons about twice a year. I'm sure it almost bankrupted the poor guy but we sure loved and appreciated. That was almost 30 years ago and I swear the place hasn't been updated since. Having said that it has one of the nicest hotel lounge/restaurants I've seen. The room was cramped and the walls were paper thin. Every time the person having a bath upstairs moved their fat arse the sound of flesh rubbing on porcellin resounded through my room. No flat screen which is pretty standard at luxury hotels these days. The toiletries that they provide are first rate and I must say that after dumping them into my shaving kit upon arival there were fresh supplies after the evening turn down service. Comfy bed but tired looking in every aspect of the room. I decided to eat at the bar. The bartenders aer super knowledgeable and friendly. I ordered from the bar menu. It was very limited. Basically if you are hungry you have the choice of a $28.00 Dungeness Crab clubhouse or the $22.00 cheese burger. I went for the burger. I figured it would be the safe choice. When it arrived I was wondering if it shouldn't have been served on a ritz cracker it was so small. But that's haute Cuisine these days so I thought what the hell. I almost choked when I tried to swallow the super charred "meat" I'm not picky but when you fork out 22 bucks for a burger it better be sublime. I called the manager over and he was very good and said he'd get another one out right away. 10 minutes later I swear it was the same burger. I called him over and cut it in front of him. I could have stood on the burger and not extraced any juice. He appologized took it off my bill etc but good god. Its a burger. I almost went Gordon Ramsay on the poor guy. "WHEN IT'S BROWN ITS COOKED, WHEN IT'S BLACK IT'S FOOKED!!!!"

Reviews.Title: “Recommend the Four Seasons!”
Reviews.Author: maldivesod
Reviews.Content: The Four Season is a terrific property and I highly recommend it. The room I had (queen deluxe) was large and had a very warm and comfortable feel to it. Very nice seating area with arm chair and ottoman, work desk, and the bed and the linens were superb. The bathrooms stock fine toiletries. Great selection on the room service menu--the hotel does open to a very large shopping mall (Pacific Centre) which is fun to browse and has a food court if you have the urge to snack.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, but needs a remodel”
Reviews.Author: blumay
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend getaway. Fantastic location, great service, great beds, cool bar/restaurant in lobby, excellent pool/hot tub/workout area. However, rooms need an overall upgrade as they are really dated for $300/night.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect Four Seasons Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Briandw
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Four Seasons Hotel Vancouver in March, 2008, of course expecting Four Seasons Luxury. In a nutshell, Four Seasons Vancouver is located in the center of Vancouver, BC with excellent accessibility to various tourist attractions, but it's got outdated and dirty in-room facility; about 7-foot ceiling, cheap restroom door made of MDF, small tube TV(not even a flat TV), dirty light switches and mold buildup on silicon caulking in bathroom. In terms of facility, it is a 3-star nationwide hotel. Good thing about this hotel is service. Bell desk is highly efficient and courteous and check-in/out were flawless. After check-in, a bottle of milk was provided for my kids. If you want a great location, it's a good hotel for you, but, if what you want is a Four Seasons Luxury, please expect it in Four Seasons elsewhere, not in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Vancouver Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: sarah-louise
Reviews.Content: I have lost count of the number of times we've stayed here, it's my favourite hotel in Vancouver. A classic hotel which is ideally placed for shopping as it's on top of the Pacific Centre. We had a corner room which was spacious and had a great view. Highly recommend having the buffet breakfast at least once - you won't eat again all day! The staff are very polite and the concierge remembered our names and greeted us each time! Stay here - you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Just Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Another_Visitor
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in mid-December. I was very impressed with the hotel upon arriving and still impressed upon leaving three days later. The staff were very friendly and helpful; the room was very nice with an extra large bathroom - it was also clean and well looked after. My only comment might be that it looked as if the room had recently been upgraded - but it still showed some signs of it’s previous days though nothing serious - that said I was still very pleased and impressed. I had room service two nights - just excellent and good value - no complaints. Hotel has a great downtown location - there are several Starbucks and Tim Horton’s within two blocks, which are great for an inexpensive breakfast. I didn’t try the hotel restaurant, but it looked interesting. Finally, in 3 days of coming and going - I only had to open the entrance door - ONCE !!! - every other time it was opened by a cheerful Doorman (morning and evening) - never had that happen to me before. Would I stay there again - definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the new restaurant - Yew.”
Reviews.Author: Debbyghouston
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Vancouver has a great location and fantastic service. The new restaurant Yew has a unique and tasty menu - would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great service, and yes, dated rooms”
Reviews.Author: SheaG
Reviews.Content: I got a great rate on a superior room through an obscure travel website. Having read the TA reviews, I wouldn't have booked the room if I hadn't gotten such a great rate. I am glad I did. The service was great, wonderful FS service. We were upgraded upon arrival to a corner room on the 24th floor that had great views. But yes, the room is dated. They are renovating and they need it. The decor is not attractive. The TV/electronics are old. The bathrooms are nothing special like most Four Seasons. But everything else is in place for this hotel. The bed and linens were simply wonderful. Bathroom products and extras are all there. Service is exemplary. The concierge gave me truly great dinner recommendations on two different nights (CinCin and Baru Latino, both HIGHLY recommended). The location is great, right across from the Art Gallery and in the midst of all the shopping. Every employee treated us incredibly nicely. Service was just fantastic. The new restaurant, Yew, had just opened a week before our mid-December stay. We didn't eat there, but did go to the bar both nights. It is a beautiful, beautiful space. Again, great service. I would definitely stay again, probably after the renovation, though. Then it will be world-class.

Reviews.Title: “It's the service that will have me return”
Reviews.Author: ABtraveller
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed with the Four Season's service. The bellman radio'd my name to the front desk, so they greeted me by name. My 20th floor room was elegant. Nice size. Chairs had been recovered. Wood desk and chest are old, but nothing you'd want to see thrown out. Closet includes safe. There's an in-room coffee maker and stocked bar fridge. Popcorn/stucco ceiling. The evening turn-down service is very useful. I really enjoyed the indoor-outdoor pool to swim lengths. Used the fitness equipment there one night - and the staff clean off the equipment for you. Saunas are in the change rooms. A business centre has 2 computers for use day or night. If you can be 14 mins or less, no charge. They track by the centre key you obtain at the front desk. There are currently some renovations going on the 2nd/3rd floor. This hotel is part of the Pacific Centre downtown mall.

Reviews.Title: “Dated hotel, wonderful staff, but really needs updating”
Reviews.Author: jandktravelers
Reviews.Content: We chose this property based on our other experiences with The Four Seasons (Maui, Austin, New York, Atlanta) and and we were SHOCKED at the lack of updating. As usual, the staff was flawless, but the property is not comparable to the others we've visited. We were upgraded to a suite, but upon opening the door we discovered it was simply two identical rooms that had a french door knocked out of the common wall. It was mostly quiet, but we could hear the upstairs guests milling about on occasion. The ceiling had the original popcorn acoustic texturing from the 70s. The mini-spa had been updated, but I had to return to the spa desk to request a comb and a razor and the products in the dressing area and showers were very inferior. Attached is a photograph of one of the chairs in our room, which we are giving the "Worst Chair We've Ever Seen in a Four Seasons Award." While Vancouver is a world class destination, this hotel won't be without major renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, friendly, very beautiful + fabulous service”
Reviews.Author: lovestheoceanandmtns
Reviews.Content: My husband had to attend a conference at the Four Seasons so my daughter and I decided to go along as we have never been to Vancouver. Such a beautiful city and what a wonderful hotel. The people that work there were so warm, friendly and informative. We loved out room and the great view. The concierge, bellmen and valets provided us a wealth of information on what to do, where to dine, etc. I loved the location as it was so close to Standley Park, Granville Island, Shopping, access to the Sky Train that zips you all over downtown. The Four Seasons housekeeping dept. should be applauded as they go the extra mile to make evrything grand. We also loved the pool, spa are and excercise room and the people that worked there. I would stay at the Four Seasons, Vancouver again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Four Seasons Service, Dated Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Freak77
Reviews.Content: The hotels is in a great central location and has all of the expected Four Seasons service elements. Every person I encountered was professional and courteous. Room service was prompt and of high quality. The problem is the very dated and cramped rooms. Everything is clean but there is a slightly depressed air about the place. My internet connection in room was balky and slow, TV sets seemed from the mid-80's. The place needs a complete freshening up.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: MDSLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a few nights en route to Tofino and thought this was a disappointing hotel for the Four Seasons brand. Totally average 'business hotel', bland dated decor, small double rooms with tiny bathrooms, impersonal enormous lobby, very much an anonymous chain feel. Having said that the location was good, the bar ok, the pool was lovely (if needing renovation), and the service helpful, but none of this could make it a stay worth the price we were paying. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for exploring Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: MumTraveller
Reviews.Content: The booking agent had assured us that we would have a room with 2 double beds (family of 4 in one room, to keep costs down) but the hotel did not have this instruction and had booked us in a one-bedded room. They changed the room straight away but we were then in a two-doubled bedded room on a lower floor looking out on the air conditioning - not inspiring. However, they redeemed themselves by placing another fold out bed in the room (unasked, they just realised that a 10 year old and 12 year old only share a bed uncomfortably) and providing milk and cookies for the kids. The room with 3 beds was crowded, but we all slept well, which is the main thing. Swimming pool and roof garden lovely, and we made good use of them. Excellent situation for walking round Vancouver, close to Canada Place, Gastown etc.

Reviews.Title: “Short stay w/ kids - GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: ReillyWood
Reviews.Content: We just finished a short 2 night stay at the Four Seasons with our children - 8 & 12. We upgraded to a suite when we arrived - though more expensive, we weren't crowded. We slept comfortably on the king bed and our kids slept comfortably on rollaway beds in the living room. I saw a review that described the decor as dated - that's about right (for our room) but the room was still very nice. We spent most of our time outside the hotel, but the kids especially liked the pool (of course) and visited it half a dozen times. Nice towels, indoor/outdoor pool (a bit too small for length swimming), large patio area (crowded around by other buildings so no view but still nice), and a decent looking exersize facility. We even had dinner by the poolside last night. We didn't eat at Chartwells, but did eat breakfast at Season's. Expensive of course (for the buffet) but very good. Their bircher muesli is exceptional. For our second breakfast we ate at Belaggio's, about a 5m walk from the hotel - very nice and half the price. We had dinner at Top of Vancouver - great site but too expensive and small dishes. There's some construction going on on the lower floors (around 2 & 3, I think). This didn't bother us (we were on the 15th floor). If the price is not an issue, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dated? Yes. But still a Four Seasons throughout.”
Reviews.Author: 2Traveller2
Reviews.Content: Yes, the rooms are dated. But they are very clean (as is to be expected from any Four Seasons), and are in very good condition, despite their age. There are many newer hotels that have more modern rooms that are already in far worse condition than the rooms at the Four Seasons Vancouver will ever be. The service is very good, and at the level expected of the chain, as are the amenities and food. If you are looking for modernity, go somewhere else, but if you are looking for the trademark Four Seasons service and quality, this Four Seasons makes the grade, even when compared to some of its younger siblings.

Reviews.Title: “very nice property”
Reviews.Author: twinexplorers
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel. It is classic. The bad reviews made me nervous. The hotel does need to be updated.... but it's not bad. If you want really a modern hotel this is not the hotel for you. If you want class and elegance, then this is a good choice. We had a great rate and got an upgraded room with a good view.

Reviews.Title: “Dated Rooms”
Reviews.Author: pjmcsmokey
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Four Seasons for three weeks on business during May 2007. The decor is very dated throughout the hotel and although the service was pleasant, it was not exceptional. Breakfast buffet was good, if a little pricey and the location is great being near to the shops of Robson Street and a 10 minute walk from the waterfront. For the price, I would imagine there are much better hotels around Vancouver. If you're looking for luxury, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Staff great, but rooms nothing special”
Reviews.Author: geekspice
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons in Vancouver isn't a bad hotel. The downtown location is good, and the staff are very nice and helpful - which is what you expect from a Four Seasons. We arrived at 4am having been on the 2am flight from NY and then struggling to locate lost luggage in the largely abandoned Vancouver airport, and the staff were nice enough to extend our checkout time to 2pm so we could get some sleep. The rooms, though, are pretty ordinary. We booked a "superior" room through the website. Both the room and the bathroom were quite small and the bathroom was very dated. The bed was comfortable, the blackout curtains are very effective, and our view of downtown was as good as any view of Vancouver could be. But I didn't feel like I was in a Four Seasons instead of a Westin or a Marriott - there's just nothing special about the place. OTOH at around ~$300/night, maybe it's not trying to be special.

Reviews.Title: “Love the staff but disappointment in dated rooms”
Reviews.Author: tinsel57
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Four Season was part of a business reward program so we were just thrilled to be here. However, I must say, I was disappointed in the dated room decor. No granite in the bath, molded tub, popcorn ceilings and dated wallpaper - not much to get excited about there. But I will say the staff was true to it's Four Season's reputation and they couldn't have fussed more over our Chihuahua - providing bedding, bowls, dog biscuits and bottled water - all served on a silver tray. Consierge service was top notch and all the meals we had were exceptional. (Though I thought breakfast at $65 for two was a bit much.) The location is very central and convenient and even with the dated decor, the bedding was comfortable, the room ample size. They seem to do a ton of prepost cruise and business traffic so be prepared for a number of groups arriving and departing on rather a continual basis. There are so many hotels in Vancouver I'd probably try a few more before I'd head back to the Four Seasons but I do think anyone could be comfortable here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service, Completely Original Interiors”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyGreen
Reviews.Content: I have been going to this hotel for the last ten years. While they have updated some of the larger suites the bulk of the rooms and the rest of the property are completely original circa early 1980s. Despite being in scenic Vancouver there are no views to speak of. The service is outstanding, typical Four Seasons. Excellent room service and a really first class gym with up to date equipment and pool. The location is fantastic and it is right on top of a mall which affords world class shopping (great for those rainy days). All in all it needs to be updated and should be what with the Olympics and the new 5 star hotels being built. I would recommend the hotel to business travelers and shoppers but not if the premium is significant to say the Opus which will shuttle you downtown in a new 7 series BMW.

Reviews.Title: “gets no better...”
Reviews.Author: alveglia
Reviews.Content: we booked a one bedroom suite. from the time we pulled in service was great. we were escorted to our room it was beautiful livingroom,dinning room ,2 bathrooms. but where the four season shines is in service. a few examples we went down to get our car to drive to whistler as soon as they heard we had towles in our car , 4 bottles of water and detail instruction from hotel. room service is to die for white table cloth they set a beautiful table and food was great. everyone greet you using your last name. i can keep going BUT, what makes the four seasons vancouver a great hotel is it great staff ! bravo to all

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Nantwich07
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in the Vancouver Four Seasons from the 21st April. I must admit to being a little apprehensive after reading some reviews saying how dated the hotel was. First impressions of the public areas unfortunately are not great. I think the lighting is poor and the escalators up to reception don't give the best impression. I have to say though, once we reached the check-in desk everything got better. The staff are really pleasant and helpful and we were allocated a suite on the 14th floor. The room was really lovely and immaculate in it's cleanliness - which rates very highly with me. We experienced room service, Chartwells Restaurant and breakfast every morning, all of which were excellent. The service provided by the concierge was really good too. Being able to access the shopping mall directly from the hotel reception was an added bonus. All in all we had a really good stay. The hotel itself may be in need of a little updating here and there, but the excellent service and high quality staff more than makes up for the faded decor. We would definitely stay here again if ever in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Faded Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: parcvue
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on a one night business trip to Canada. The hotel is nice but a bit in a 1980's time warp and needs to be updated. The room was ok, but dated and a prefab tub (like in a Super 8 Motel). The main dinning room was vacant-the food was just ok but the menu was from a diffrient decade. The staff was true Four Seasons and made this stay...just fine, but not special

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: TamaBlue
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business and this might account for why our stay was so pleasant. We had about 8 rooms booked for 14 days, including one of the suites. They treated us like royalty. I've read the other reviews on this hotel and wonder if I'd be as psyched about this place had I been just a regular tourist renting a room for the night or weekend, instead of one in a large party of coworkers and clients. Four Seasons hotels have consistent good service, but the main reason I stayed here is because it was one of the best deals in town. The business rate for our rooms was cheaper than most of the 3-4 star hotels iin town. (I actually had to present the bills to my accounting department after our client accused us of splurging on their dime -- they didn't believe it was really the best deal in town!) All of my business needs were met -- FedExes to and from the US, faxes, local couriers, last minute car service requests, last minute room changes, etc. All of the normal stuff that happens on a business trip were dealt with in an extremely efficient manner. I trusted the concierge with all of my numerous, annoying requests. The food was great as always, though not cheap. The pool looked beautiful and coworkers said they enjoyed it (I did not have a chance to partake even though I looked at it longingly every day from my hotel window....) The location is also good - right by a mall and one of the main streets (can't remember the name) for shopping and restaurants. The weather was beautiful when we were there and I fell in love with the city. If I were to visit Vancouver with my husband I don't know if I would stay here -- it sounds like its strength is accomodating business travelers, but perhaps not so great with those staying for personal trips.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: mecas36
Reviews.Content: We booked two adjacent rooms on a "non-smoking" floor. They were dusty, damp and smelled like old stale cigarette smoke. The staff were friendly but the hotel needs to be gutted. Do not stay there if you have asthma.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Family Reunion Stay”
Reviews.Author: MisterW
Reviews.Content: Allow my to preface this review by saying that the standard I'm using is quite high and should be. After all, this is a Four Seasons hotel. We were planning a small family reunion and were staying at the property for only one night prior to a cruise. Because there were multiple rooms involved, we spent quite a while making the arrangements with the hotel staff prior to arrival. The service we received was excellent from both the front desk staff and concierge to arrange misc details prior to arrival. Many hotels offer no help if any prior to arrival. That was not the case here. The rooms were very nice. We booked both Premiere Rooms as well as an Executive Suite. The Premiere rooms were very much like Jr Suites and very spacious with corner views on the city below. The Executive Suite was even larger with two complete rooms and a spectacular view of the water and mountains (not to mention the magnificent pool deck complete with paths, waterfalls and a running brook). The decor of the rooms was a bit "antique" for my taste, but such is common with the Four Seasons, especially older ones. It could probably use a bit of a renovation as well, but overall I was very happy with the quality, size, amenities and views of the rooms. During our stay, the entire front desk and concierge staff was excellent. Due to the complexity of planning the stay and schedule of several people, we made many requests and they were all taken care of with the top service you would expect from a Four Seasons. They even arranged for an in-room massage that was perfection. There were a couple of minor problems related to a biling issue and a room service amenity delivery. Now, these were both very minor issues and not something I would penalize a hotel for in my rating. However, the sole reason I'm rating this hotel with a 4 and not a 5 is because of the experience we had when we went down to the front desk to enquire about these issues. Now, granted it was very late (around midnight) and so the normal staff wasn't there. But the gentlemen manning the desk, although not outright rude, was apathetic and only partially helped us and even then only after prodding. He was also rude to other staff members for no reason in front of us. To the Four Seasons manager - all it takes is one bad experience with a staff member like this to tarnish an otherwise perfect stay. He gave us the service I would expect from a 2 star hotel, not a Four Seasons. I don't want to leave you with a bad impression of this hotel, however. I have no regrets for choosing to stay here for our family and overall the quality of the hotel and service we received was absolutely excellent and what you would expect from a Four Seasons. I would reccomend this hotel although I might try one of Vancouver's other top hotels if I return again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go until it's refurbished”
Reviews.Author: eh555
Reviews.Content: As noted in the last review, this is NOT a Four Seasons - at least it doesnt feel like one. We splurged for a "deluxe executive suite" for $575/night, and while it was quite large, it was downright shabby. Yes, shabby. That is not a word that I have ever thought could be used for a Four Seasons, but I am not exagerating - old, worn, low ceilinged, boxey rooms that felt more like a Crown Plaza than a Four Seasons. We left atfer one night, and to their credit, the front desk staff was very understanding and didn't charge us any early departure fees - I think they had heard our comments before.

Reviews.Title: “Stay for the service”
Reviews.Author: MJPBAF
Reviews.Content: We’re avid readers of hotel review sites like Trip Advisor and Fodors, so our expectations for this hotel were based on other people’s reviews. We knew that it would be dated and in need of a renovation, but we didn’t know if it would retain that certain Four Seasons charm that makes a stay in almost any one of their properties memorable in the best way. We’re happy to report that it did, and we only wish we could have stayed longer. Why? One word: service. We enjoyed the bar with its intimate, relaxing spaces and the breakfast restaurant with its soaring windows. In both cases, we had the excellent service we’ve come to expect from the Four Seasons. And the food and drink were wonderful – the breakfast is definitely worth it. The reviews were right about one thing: the hotel should be renovated. Hotel styles change and this hotel, which seems in some ways stuck in the 80s, should reflect that. Except for the bar, it lacks intimate spaces that make it feel more cozy, comfortable and exclusive and the relative (for a Four Seasons) plainness of its larger public spaces doesn’t convey the typical Four Seasons ambiance we’ve become accustomed to in our travels around the world. We were upgraded to a Corner Deluxe Room with wonderful wraparound windows affording a view of the city and some of the mountains. The room had a comfortable bed and a nice layout, but the garish curtains and dated furniture were a drawback. We also thought the somewhat cramped bathroom was a bit dowdy; it was not as nice as the relaxing oases we’ve seen in other Four Seasons properties. This is a fine hotel, in a city that seems to be changing overnight. Four Seasons is smart to have a property in Vancouver, now they just need one that reflects the dynamism and style of the city around it.

Reviews.Title: “An American in Canada”
Reviews.Author: Dr. Pub
Reviews.Content: Mrs. Pub and I stayed at the Four Seasons Vancouver for four nights in July. It was 100 degrees back home, but the highs were in the mid 70's in Vancouver. Absolutely perfect weather. About the hotel: 1. LOCATION: in the middle of downtown. Robson Street (known for its shopping) is two blocks away. The Pacific Centre mall is attached to the hotel. Lots of cafes, stores, restaurants within a few blocks. Cabs were always available at the hotel. Stanley Park was about an $8 cab ride away. 2. ROOM: We reserved and received a Deluxe Corner Room (2208) on the 22nd floor. We had a nice view of the harbour around Canada Place, and the mountains in the background. The Deluxe Corner room is a mild upgrade with floor to ceiling windows on two sides. Furnished nicely. 3. AMENITIES: A very nice indoor/outdoor swimming pool (heated) with exercise equipment on one side of it. No extra charge for the fitness equipment nor the pool. Cocktail and food service on the outdoor patio portion of the pool. Very nice public areas. Staff was always very nice and helpful. 4. FOOD: Didn't eat in the restaurants. Had room service breakfast once and cheese and wine in the bar once. 5. VALUE: Rack rate on this room was $430 per night; I reserved it for the Entertainment Card rate of $215 per night. I did have to show my Entertainment card at check in (a first). If you are not familiar with Entertainment card or Hotels at Half Price, check out Travelers Advantage at [--] Travelers Advantage now costs about $10 per month, but they have a trial membership for only $1 for two months. However, if you don't call and cancel, they will automatically bill your credit card each month. It may seem costly to join a "travel club" for , but I saved over $800 on one four night stay, so it pays off. Keep in mind that not all hotels listed have the Half Price room availability for the specific dates that you want to stay. It can be frustrating at first. You have to work at it a little bit to get the discounted rate at a suitable hotel. If the toll free reservations are not successful, try the direct call to the hotel. Ask for the "Entertainment Rate". If they have a good rate, book it and join Travelers Advantage with specific instructions to send you a card/sticker soon. Hope this helps. Dr. Pub

Reviews.Title: “Consistency is the heart of a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jackfurlongesq_123
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Four Seasons Vancouver twice, five years' apart. The result was timeless. That is, both times the service was superb, the rooms immaculate and extremely comfortable, the location perfect to see this wonderful city. Too often, the passage of time dulls the staff or the decor. Not FS Vancouver. Flagship property of our favorite hotel company, folks here are helpful and accommodating. Beware cruise ship schedules, when the driveway, the lobby, and the restaurant can be suddenly overwhelmed with a flood of, um, cruise types (not a personal assessment, just an awareness of herd mentality.) Great pool and workout spa on the fourth floor (so you don't have to parade in your robe through the lobby.)

Reviews.Title: “Consistently superb”
Reviews.Author: blout
Reviews.Content: I'm a frequent visitor to Vancouver for business/pleasure and have stayed at virtually all of the top hotels (Wedgewood, Opus, Hotel Vancouver, Pan Pacific). The Four Seasons is by far my favorite choice due to its very comfortable and spacious rooms, incredible beds, superb service, and nearly perfect location. What sets most Four Seasons aparts is the quality of their rooms, and this one is no exception. Rooms are very spacious, quiet, and comfortable, featuring FS's legendary beds and stunning views of the city (particularly on the north side of the hotel). While the decor is a bit dated, the hotel is extremely well maintained. Rooms and public areas are immaculately clean, so you won't find random stains and damaged furniture here. Housekeeping here is better than virtually any hotel I've ever stayed at, including some of the world's finest (Peninsula/Beverly Hills, Four Seasons/George V, Mandarin Oriental/Hong Kong). Rooms are freshed up with laser-like precision, and turn-down service always results in a perfectly-made bed. The housekeeping team is friendly, highly responsive, and professional, like all of the staff here. In the end, what impresses me most is the FS's incredible consistency. I've stayed here probably 20x in the last five years and almost never had an issue. The one time I had a problem was when the hotel's cramped driveway was backed up due to an arriving wedding party, making it impossible for me to retrieve my car for over an hour. The valet team was barely apologetic, which surprised me. This was a rare aberration, however. The FS may not be the most stylish hotel from an architecture and design standpoint, but it excels in the things that really matter -- room comfort, service, cleanliness, and quality. I strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Faboulus Service”
Reviews.Author: TravellerTM
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights while checking out Vancouver, The hotel is brilliantly placed in the middle of downtown city. Got a room on the top floor (28 floor), the room was big with a really nice view of the city, and even if the room is not newly decorated its was immaculate and clean. The food in the hotel is very very nice and the service at the hotel is (naturally?) brilliant. So I highly reccomened spending a few extra Canadian dollars to experience this hotel and location.

Reviews.Title: “World Class Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: acchi
Reviews.Content: This is one of the greatest hotels on Earth! Personally, I have stayed here over thirty different times. With little exception the hotel is a winner. Yes, the hotel needs a bit of a face lift, but it is spotless and the service is superb. The pool is one of a kind..the inside outside pool for swimming, dining and workouts all year round. I have stayed at many Four Seasons Hotels and not many hold a candle to this one! The new remodel should be finished soon.

Reviews.Title: “Old Hotel but with Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stay in this hotel for 3 nights on first of Dec this year. As the comments from other people that is a "old" hotel and indeed to have a renovation. However the staff service is excellent and make you feel warm even in the snowy day. The location is quite convenience for people to shop around.

Reviews.Title: “Expect a Hilton, not Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: B_Shao
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 25 years old and has not been renovated, and it shows its age in ways more than one. The service is great, as expected at Four Seasons properties, but rooms and lobby are the worst I have seen at any four seasons around the world. For example, the bathroom is small, with a simple bath tub and vinyl shower curtains - no separate shower area. We were told by locals that it "was" the top hotel in Vancouver 10 years ago but has long been surpassed by other, newer, 5 star properties.
